name: 'Skilled' Actor
description: When acting in a way that would require you to use a non-Charisma skill as part of the act you can roll that skill as part of the act, using your Act Skill bonus. Any outcomes of that Skill roll cannot have lasting effects after the act is over, unless those effects are negative.

name: A Martial's Power
description: Choose one Power that only contains Power parts. You may add your Martial Proficiency to its relevant d20 rolls and potencies, treating it as a Power Proficiency for that Power. You may choose which Power this is after each Partial Recovery.

name: Abjure
description: As a basic action, you may make a power attack against creatures' Resolve within 12 spaces of you. You may target a number of creatures equal to your Power Ability. On a success, a target becomes frightened.

name: Abundant Harvest
description: When you succeed a Harvest check to collect forageables, you also gain an additional ¼ of the value of your main harvest in ingredients that can be used for a different purpose.

name: Abundant Harvest II
description: When you succeed a Harvest check to collect forageables, you also gain an additional 1/2 of the value of your main harvest in ingredients that can be used for a different purpose.

name: Acrobat
description: With a successful Acrobatics roll (DS 10), you can maneuver through foliage or terrain that allows for aerial acrobatics, such as trees or rafters, ignoring difficult terrain and increasing your speed by 2 for the turn.

name: Action Surge
description: As a free action, gain 2 action points.

name: Action Surge II
description: As a free action, gain 2 action points.

name: Adapt
description: Add 1 technique part you are proficient with to a technique upon performing it. Pay the Energy cost for said part. (This does not permanently add technique parts.)

name: Adapt II
description: Add up to 2 technique parts you are proficient with to a technique upon performing it. Pay the Energy cost for said parts. (This does not permanently add technique parts, only upon performing.)

name: ADHD
description: You can focus on two powers at a time, but while doing so, you have -5 on rolls to maintain focus. Roll once for maintaining focus for both powers, losing focus on both on a failure.

name: Adrenaline
description: Your Terminal range increases by 1/2 your Vitality multiplied by your Level to a maximum Terminal range of 75% of your Max Health. This scales off your base Vitality, not including any penalties or bonuses to your Vitality.

name: Adrenaline II
description: Your Terminal range increases by 1/2 Vitality multiplied by your Level plus 2 to a maximum Terminal range of 85% of your Max Health. This scales off your base Vitality, not including any penalties or bonuses to your Vitality.

name: Advanced Attack
description: Once per turn, when you make a martial attack with an outside bonus more than or equal to +3, you can add 1d6 damage to that attack. Outside bonuses could be bonuses from feats, powers, techniques, or other environmental factors that are not your martial attack bonus.

name: Advanced Recall
description: When attempting to recall information with a roll, you may choose to treat the roll as if it rolled a 20. Alternatively, you may allow an ally to re-roll an Intelligence-based roll to recall information.

name: Aerial Tumbler
description: Increase your long jump distance by your half Acrobatics Skill Bonus.

name: Agile Armament
description: When wearing armor with a Strength requirement, you may meet that requirement with Agility and Strength combined, to a maximum of 3 from Agility contributing to the requirement.

name: Agile Escape
description: When rolling to escape the Grappled or Restrained conditions or similar effects, you may use Reflex instead of Might.

name: Alchemist
description: When crafting items using Alchemy treat Failures as one Failure less, or one Success higher, which can turn 1 Failure into 1 Success. Treat partial failures as one Success.

name: Alchemist's Support
description: You may administer enhanced consumables made using Alchemy to other creatures as a free action, still requiring an interaction.

name: All-Seeing
description: As a basic action, you gain the ability to sense all creatures as if you could see them within 12 spaces for one minute. You ignore any Obscured, Hidden, and Invisible conditions affecting those creatures.

name: Always Prepared
description: You cannot be surprised. If an ally within 6 spaces than can hear or see would become surprised you may spend a quick reaction to prevent them from becoming surprised.

name: Amplify
description: Increase the damage of any power upon casting it by paying +1 Energy for each +1d2 (up to +1d6 added damage for 3 Energy).

name: Amplify II
description: Increase the damage of any power upon casting it by paying +1 Energy, for each +1d2 (up to +1d12 added damage for 6 Energy).

name: Anatomy
description: Choose 1 creature type or species other than humanoid; your attack rolls and potencies are increased by +2 against targets of this creature type or species as long as you can see them.

name: Anatomy II
description: For the chosen creature type or species your attack rolls and potencies are increased by 4 against targets of this creature type or species as long as you can see them.

name: Anger Point
description: When you take critical damage, increase your Strength by +1 for two rounds.

name: Anger Point II
description: When you take critical damage, increase your Strength by +2 for two rounds.

name: Animal Speaking
description: You may spend a basic action to gain the ability to speak with animals using simple universal language. Only you can understand their replies, and the animals can only understand you.

name: Arcane Analyst
description: When attempting to appraise or understand an enhanced item, you may add 1/2 of your Intelligence to the roll if you've encountered something similar before, even if the Roll already uses Intelligence.

name: Arcane Ward
description: Choose a power part category (Charm, Defense, Illusion, Control, etc.). The first time you use a non-innate power each Full Recovery, with only parts of this type (and General/Mechanic parts), you overheal an amount equal to your level plus your power ability. Each time you use this type of power after this, you only overheal an amount equal to half of your level.

name: Arcane Ward II
description: The first time you use a non-innate power each Full Recovery, with only parts of this category (and General/Mechanic parts), you overheal an amount equal to double your level plus your power ability. Each time you use this type of power after this, you only overheal an amount equal to your level.

name: Armament Recycling
description: You can harvest materials from armaments in half the regular time. When using materials harvested from armaments to craft, increase their effective currency value by 50%.
req_desc: Proficiency in the skill required to craft the armament you are harvesting from.

name: Armor Bearer
description: Decrease the Training Point requirement to acquire proficiency with armor properties by 1 to a minimum of 1 (You spend one fewer Training Point per armor property proficiency gained.) You may regain any Training Points you would have saved this way on already acquired proficiencies.

name: Assassin's Blade
description: You gain access to the "Solution Compartment" weapon part, which will allow solutions to be applied to the weapon without losing potency over time. Weapons with this part require at least one glassblower to take part in the crafting process.
req_desc: Proficiency in the Tinker sub-skill

name: Assassin's Delight
description: Add 1d2 damage to attacks for every enemy death this combat, up to 1d6. This effect lasts 2 rounds but is refreshed after every enemy death.

name: Astral Projection
description: As part of activating this state, or as a basic action during a state, you may step out of your body. While in this state, you gain: 1. Resistance to physical attacks and vulnerability to Holy/Spiritual damage, 2. A flying speed equal to 1/2 your movement speed, 3. The ability to pass through solid objects (anything that hosts no spirit). When you enter this state, your body falls prone and is left in a state of suspended animation. You may choose to end this effect as a free action on your turn, either having your spirit return to your body or vice versa.

name: Astral Reach
description: When you make an attack with unarmed prowess, you may use a free action to gain the "Reach" property on all unarmed prowess attacks for 3 rounds, increasing the melee range of your unarmed prowess by 1.

name: Astral Sight
description: You can see in normal and magical darkness out to 12 spaces.
req_desc: The ability to see in darkness

name: Astute Discovery
description: When rolling a skill to gain or recall knowledge, or learn about something new, even if you fail the check, you still obtain a piece of true information. You are unaware which piece of information this is as given you by the Realm Master.

name: Astute Tracking
description: When you make a successful roll to track, you also learn the tracked creature's creature type(s) and how many you are tracking.

name: At the Ready
description: Gain +8 on initiative rolls. If you would be surprised you may choose to sacrifice this bonus to not become surprised.

name: Attack of Opportunity
description: If a creature leaves your melee range, you may react by spending 2 AP to take a basic action.

name: Attack of Opportunity II
description: If a creature moves out of your melee range, you may react by spending 2 AP to take a basic action. Upon hitting the creature you may cause it's speed to become 0 for the turn instead.

name: Attack of Opportunity III
description: If a creature moves out of or into your melee range, you may react by spending 2 AP to take a basic action. Upon hitting the creature you may cause it's speed to become 0 for the turn instead.

name: Attack Pattern Prediction
description: Increase your Evasion by +1 for every 2 times you are attacked by a chosen target, up to a maximum of +3.

name: Aura of Speed
description: Gain 2 to your speed. Creatures other than you who start their turn within 2 spaces of you gain 2 to their speed for the round.

name: Awakened Power
description: When using a power with the "rite" power part, you may cast it as a Basic Action instead.

name: Backstab
description: When attacking while hidden from your target, gain an extra 1d4 damage. You may level this feat, increasing the die by 1d4 each level.

name: Balance
description: As a basic reaction to a creature you can see rolling a d20 with outside bonuses or penalties, you may choose to remove all outside bonuses or penalties. Outside bonuses and penalties could be bonuses from feats, powers, techniques, or other environmental factors that are not an archetype attack bonus or skill bonus.

name: Bastion
description: As a basic action, you may give a creature you can see within 6 spaces other than you a number of d8s which they can use as part of a free reaction to taking damage, reducing the damage by the amount rolled on the d8s. The number of dice you may give is represented by uses of this feat, you can give as many or few as you desire. They lose all dice when taking a Full Recovery.

name: Battle Magic
description: When you use a power with a basic action, you may use a quick action to attack with a weapon as well. This attack has no multiple attack penalty but increases this penalty for future actions as normal.

name: Battle-Ready
description: You may sleep without doffing armor.

name: Battlefield Tactician
description: Make an Analyze skill roll against the Resolve of an enemy you can see. On a success, each ally who can hear you gains a +1 to attack rolls against the target for 3 rounds. This effect cannot stack.
req_desc: Acuity or Intelligence of at least 3

name: Battlefield Tactician II
description: Make an Analyze skill roll against the Resolve of an enemy you can see. On a success, each ally who can hear you gains a +2 to attack rolls against the target for 3 rounds. This effect cannot stack.
req_desc: Acuity or Intelligence of at least 3

name: Battlefield Tactician III
description: Make an Analyze skill roll against the Resolve of an enemy you can see. On a success, each ally who can hear you gains a +2 to attack rolls against the target for 4 rounds. This effect cannot stack.
req_desc: Acuity or Intelligence of at least 4

name: Beast Sense
description: You may spend a basic action to touch a willing animal or beast and gain the ability to see, hear, taste, and smell as if you were the animal, and you retain the ability to perceive through your own senses. This effect lasts until you choose to end it or for 1 hour, whichever comes first.

name: Beguiling Magic
description: When you use a non-innate power with a charm or illusion part, you may choose a creature within 12 spaces. The target rolls Resolve against your Potency and becomes your choice of frightened 2 or charmed for 1 minute on a failure.
req_desc: At least 20 Max Energy

name: Bend Fate
description: When a creature you can see within 12 spaces rolls a d20, you may use a quick reaction roll 1d4, adding or reducing that number from the roll before or after knowing the results.

name: Bend Fate II
description: When a creature you can see within 12 spaces rolls a d20, you may use a quick reaction roll 1d6, adding or reducing that number from the roll before or after knowing the results.

name: Bend Fate III
description: When a creature you can see within 12 spaces rolls a d20, you may use a quick reaction roll 1d6, adding or reducing that number from the roll before or after knowing the results.

name: Bend Fate IV
description: When a creature you can see within 12 spaces rolls a d20, you may use a quick reaction roll 1d8, adding or reducing that number from the roll before or after knowing the results.

name: Berserk
description: While in Terminal, increase your Strength by +1/4.

name: Berserk II
description: While in Terminal, increase your Strength by +1/2.

name: Berserk III
description: While in Terminal, double your Strength.

name: Blessed Healer
description: When you heal creature(s) with a power, you heal yourself for 1 for every 5 Energy that power cost.

name: Blessed Healer II
description: When you heal creature(s) with a power, you overheal yourself for 1 for every 5 Energy that power cost.

name: Blessed Healing State
description: When you heal creature(s) with a power, you heal yourself for 2 for every 5 energy that power cost.

name: Blessed Healing State II
description: When you heal creature(s) with a power, you overheal yourself for 2 for every 5 energy that power cost.

name: Blessed Trickster
description: As a basic action, you may choose a creature within 12 spaces and give them +2 on any Stealth or Hide rolls they make. Treat failure on these rolls as one Failure more. This effect persists until you take a full recovery. You may use this feat as many times as you'd like, but once you use it, the effect ends on any other creature you've used it on.

name: Blessed Trickster II
description: As a basic action, you may choose a creature within 12 spaces and give them +4 on any Stealth or Hide rolls they make. Treat failure on these rolls as one Failure more. This effect persists until you take a full recovery. You may use this feat as many times as you'd like, but once you use it, the effect ends on any other creature you've used it on.

name: Blindsight
description: You can perceive your surroundings without relying on sight out to 3 spaces.

name: Blindsight II
description: You can perceive your surroundings without relying on sight out to 6 spaces.

name: Blindsight III
description: You can perceive your surroundings without relying on sight out to 12 spaces.

name: Blood in the Eye
description: When a creature deals critical damage to you, decrease their rolls to hit by 2 for 3 rounds. This effect cannot stack with itself.

name: Blood in the Eye II
description: When a creature deals critical damage to you, decrease their rolls to hit by 3 for 3 rounds. This effect cannot stack with itself.

name: Blood Magic
description: When your Energy is at or would go below 0, you may choose to use 3 of your Health for every 2 Energy you spend. If your Vitality is less than 0, you must use 2 Health per 1 Energy.

name: Bloodlust
description: Increase your Strength by +1 for each terminal enemy in a combat encounter, losing the increase when said creatures die, leave the combat, or are healed from terminal. Maximum of +3.

name: Bloodrush
description: Increase your Agility by +1 for each terminal in a combat encounter, losing the increase when said creatures die, leave the combat, or are healed from terminal. Maximum of +3

name: Body of Resistance
description: You have resistance to your choice between piercing, bludgeoning, or slashing damage. You can take this feat multiple time, but must be at least level 10 the second time you take it, and level 15 the third. The Vitality requirement increases by 1 for each additional time you take this feat.

name: Body Positive
description: Once per round when you deal critical damage using unarmed prowess you may increase your Charisma by 1 for 2 rounds. This effect cannot stack with itself, but renews the duration each time it is triggered while already active.

name: Body Positive II
description: Once per round when you deal critical damage using unarmed prowess you may increase your Charisma by 2 for 3 rounds. This effect cannot stack with itself, but renews the duration each time it is triggered while already active.

name: Book of Life
description: After finishing a Full Recovery, you may choose 6 creatures. Whenever one of these creatures would enter the dying condition while you can see them, you may spend this feat's use as a free reaction to cause them to drop to 1 Health instead. Only 6 creatures can be chosen at a time.

name: Book of Life II
description: After finishing a Full Recovery, you may choose 6 creatures. Whenever one of these creatures would enter the dying condition while you can see them, you may spend this feat's use as a free reaction to cause them to drop to 1 Health instead. Only 6 creatures can be chosen at a time.

name: Brandish
description: When you are holding a weapon and roll to Intimidate, you treat rolls as one Success higher.

name: Brandish II
description: When you are holding a weapon roll to Intimidate, you treat rolls as two Successes higher.

name: Breath Regulation
description: When holding your breath you can double the length of time you're able to do so provided you move no more than 1 space each round.

name: Bribes
description: When making Charisma Skill rolls to Persuade or Charm those of a higher social or economic class than you, you may spend 50 in currency to increase the roll bonus by +1, turning over the currency to the individual. Each 50 turned on grants you +1 to the roll. Sometimes characters don't take bribes.

name: Brutal Critical
description: When you achieve a critical hit, you deal 4 extra damage.

name: Brutal Critical II
description: When you achieve a critical hit, you deal 6 extra damage.

name: Brutal Critical III
description: When you achieve a critical hit, you deal 8 extra damage.

name: Brutal Critical IV
description: When you achieve a critical hit, you deal 10 extra damage.

name: Brute Force
description: When making martial attacks, treat rolling 1's on damage dice as rolling 2's instead.

name: Brute Force II
description: When making martial attacks, treat any roll on your damage dice that is less than a quarter of the die size as equal to a quarter of the die size (i.e. 2 for 1d6, 2 for 1d8, 3 for 1d12, and 4 for 2d8).

name: Brute Force III
description: When making martial attacks, treat any roll on your damage dice that is less than half the die size as equal to half the die size (i.e. 3 for 1d6, 4 for 1d8, and 8 for 2d8).

name: Brute Savagery
description: When you achieve a critical hit, the target hit becomes Frightened 2 of you for 2 rounds, using your Potency to overcome on subsequent rounds.

name: Bump, Set, Spike
description: When attacking a target that is not touching the ground, increase your attack roll by +3.

name: Calculated Navigation
description: When you attempt to navigate, you may spend 10 additional minutes in preparation prior to rolling then treating successes as one Success higher.

name: Camouflage
description: When you or an ally are attempting to use the Hide skill, you may spend 10 minutes per person to grant a bonus to the roll equal to the Skill Bonus of your Artistry Skill.

name: Captivating Performance
description: After entertaining or performing for an audience for at least 1 minute, you gain a +2 bonus on Charm skill rolls when interacting with members of that audience for the next 24 hours.

name: Careful Blaster
description: When using an Area of Effect Power that would harm you or your allies, you may choose a number of creatures equal to 1/2 your Power Bonus to automatically Overcome that power. If the power would deal half damage on a Successful Overcome, it instead deals no damage to those creatures.

name: Careful Blaster II
description: When using an Area of Effect Power that would harm you or your allies, you may choose a number of creatures equal to your Power Bonus to automatically Overcome that power. If the power would deal half damage on a Successful Overcome, it instead deals no damage to those creatures.

name: Careful Investigation
description: When rolling to Investigate an object that requires you to touch and manipulate it you have a +10 to overcome any negative effect that would occur as a result of the investigation and manipulation.

name: Catch Projectile
description: As a Quick Reaction to being attacked by a physical projectile, roll an unarmed prowess attack against the attack roll; if you meet or exceed the attack roll, you take 1d10 less damage. If this reduces the entire damage, you catch the projectile and can make an unarmed prowess ranged attack with at a target within 6 spaces using that same projectile as part of the same reaction.

name: Catch Projectile II
description: As a Quick Reaction to being attacked by a physical projectile, roll an unarmed prowess attack against the attack roll; if you meet or exceed the attack roll, you take 1d12 + Martial Bonus less damage. If this reduces the entire damage, you catch the projectile and can make an unarmed prowess ranged attack with at a target within 6 spaces using that same projectile as part of the same reaction.

name: Cavalry
description: Increase Strength by +1 while on a mount.

name: Cavalry II
description: Increase Strength by +2 while on a mount.

name: Champion
description: When you make martial attacks, your critical range is lowered by 1.

name: Champion II
description: When you make martial attacks, your critical range is lowered by 2.

name: Channel Power
description: While in Combat when using a Power as part of a Prepared Action, the Power costs 3 Energy less to use to a minimum of 1.

name: Charge Attack
description: After taking the Move Action this turn, add +2 to your next Attack Roll. If you move more than 8 spaces in a straight line before attacking you can either add an additional +2 to hit or you can attempt to knock the target prone if you hit instead, rolling Might against your Potency.

name: Charged Unarmed Prowess
description: When making an attack with your unarmed prowess, you can change the damage type to Magic instead of Bludgeoning. You must choose this before dealing damage.

name: Charming Elusion
description: Increase your Evasion by 1/4 of your Charisma.

name: Charming Elusion II
description: Increase your Evasion by 1/2 of your Charisma.

name: Climber
description: You gain a Climb Speed equal to your Speed.

name: Cloak of Shadow
description: When you are Obscured by any level of darkness, you may spend a quick action to become Invisible until you take any other action or become unobscured from darkness.

name: Cloak of Shadow II
description: When you are Obscured by any level of darkness, you may spend a quick action to become Invisible until you take any other action other than the Movement, Ability Roll, or Interaction Actions. You also lose invisibility if you lose the darkness obscurity.

name: Closing Remarks
description: While in Terminal, increase your Charisma by +1/4.

name: Closing Remarks II
description: While in Terminal, increase your Charisma by +1/2.

name: Closing Remarks III
description: While in Terminal, double your Charisma.

name: Combat Analysis
description: When you roll Analyze totaling +8 or above a target's Resolve, lower your Critical Range against the target by 1. This effect can stack to a maximum reduction of 2.
req_desc: Acuity or Intelligence of at least 3

name: Combat Analysis II
description: When you roll Analyze totaling +6 or above a target's Resolve, lower your critical range against the target by 1. This effect can stack to a maximum reduction of 4.
req_desc: Acuity or Intelligence of at least 4 and at least one other Acuity or Intelligence-based feat.

name: Combat Athlete
description: When you achieve a critical hit, you may immediately move up to 6 spaces for free.

name: Combat Inspiration
description: When a creature within 12 spaces hits a creature with an attack, you may cause it to use a quick reaction and add 1d6 to its damage dealt (if any). Taking this feat again can increase the number of uses or the size of the die by 1d2.

name: Commune with Nature
description: You may spend 10 minutes connecting with the natural world around you. Plants and animals within 5 kilometers reveal information about the surrounding area, such as potential outcroppings, settlements, ruins, caves, and general wildlife.

name: Concave of Clarity
description: As a basic action, you may end all effects caused by Powers within 6 spaces of yourself.

name: Confident Prowess
description: While attempting to charm, persuade, or convince someone of your capability (real or not) to accomplish a task, you may add your Strength to any rolls or scores involved.

name: Connected Insight
description: When a creature has been affected by a Power you used for 3 or more rounds, you may learn of its resistances, vulnerabilities, and skills.

name: Countercharm
description: When a creature within 12 spaces would fail a defense roll/score to resist becoming charmed or frightened, you may use a quick reaction to grant them a bonus to that roll/score equal to your Charisma. You may only do this once per turn.

name: Crippling Specialist
description: Increase the potency of techniques applying the Slowed, Dazed, or Prone conditions by +2.

name: Crippling Strike
description: After hitting a target with a technique, you may choose to spend 1 Energy to apply Slowed 1. You may choose to increase this for each 1 Energy spent, increasing the level of Slowed to a maximum of Slowed 3 from this feat. If the technique already applies Slowed, increase it's level instead.

name: Critical Advance
description: When you achieve a critical hit, you may immediately move up to half of your Speed for free.

name: Cunning Salesman
description: When haggling prices, add your Appraise Skill Ability to the Deceive roll.

name: Cutting Remark
description: When a creature you can see within 12 spaces succeeds on a roll or deals damage, you may use a quick reaction to roll 1d6 and reduce the target's roll by that amount, potentially changing the outcome.

name: Dance Virtuoso
description: When you make a Entertain skill roll using Agility, you treat any failure as one degree of success higher, potentially turning a failure into a success.

name: Danger Sense
description: Outside of combat increase your Reflex by +2 against effects that you can see.

name: Dark Blessing
description: When you cause a creature to fall to 0 or less Health, you overheal an amount equal to half of your level.

name: Dark Blessing II
description: When you cause a creature to fall to 0 or less Health, you overheal an amount equal to half of your level plus your archetype ability. You gain this same effect when any enemy within 2 spaces of you is reduced to 0 Health or less. You can only benefit from either of these effects once per enemy.

name: Dark Blessing III
description: When you cause a creature to fall to 0 or less Health, you overheal an amount equal to your level plus your archetype ability. You gain this same effect when any enemy within 2 spaces of you is reduced to 0 Health or less. You can only benefit from either of these effects once per enemy.

name: Darkvision
description: You can see in darkness out to 6 spaces in shades of gray, and out to 12 spaces with 1 level of obscurity in shades of gray. If you have darkvision from your species, this feat increases the range of that vision by 6 spaces.

name: Deadly Strike
description: When you attack a creature that hasn't had a turn in combat, you double the damage of the attack.

name: Death Bomb
description: When you reduce a creature to 0 or less health with an attack, you may cause a 3-space-long cone facing away to explode, dealing damage equal to double either your Power or Martial Bonus as fire damage.
req_desc: At least one power, property, feat, or trait that allows for dealing fire damage.

name: Death Dodgin’
description: While in Terminal, increase your Evasion by +1/4 of your Agility.

name: Death Dodgin’ II
description: While in Terminal, increase your Evasion by +1/2 of your Agility.

name: Death Dodgin' III
description: While in Terminal, increase your Evasion by your Agility.

name: Debilitating Strikes
description: Increase the Potency of techniques applying only the Weakened effect by +1.

name: Decipher
description: You can spend time trying to make out the meaning of a code, riddle, or unknown language. Spending at least 10 minutes, you may make the appropriate Intelligence skill roll, and upon success, understand the fundamentals of the message. Each additional 10 minutes spent grants you +1 to this roll.
req_desc: Proficiency in at least 2 intelligence skills

name: Defended
description: Whenever you spend skill points to gain a defense, you may spend 3 skill points to gain 2 to that defense instead. When you take this feat, regain 1 skill point for each defense for every 2 allocated to it. Increasing a defense from an odd number to an even number only requires 1 skill point.

name: Defense Breaker
description: When you use a power that targets a defense, you may increase the Potency or Attack roll of that power by +2.

name: Defy Death
description: While you are in the dying condition, you only take half damage from the dying damage rolls. If you roll a 1 on any dying dice, you can remove that die from your dying dice. If there are ever 0 dying dice remaining, then you are stable.

name: Determined Fighter
description: Once per combat, when you start your turn, you may choose to gain a Determination Die or grant it to another ally who can see or hear you within 12 spaces.

name: Die Hard
description: If you would drop to or below 0 Health, instead set your Health equal to your Vitality.

name: Direct Hit
description: You may choose to increase the Energy cost of a power or technique before using it to increase the damage by +1 true damage, up to a maximum of +5. At an energy cost of 1 energy per 1 damage.

name: Distant Caster
description: The range of your innate powers with the "range" part is doubled. In addition, you may spend a use of this feat to temporarily double the range of a non-innate power that has the "range" part upon using it.

name: Distant Power
description: When you use a power with a range grater than 1 space or melee, you may double that power's range. If the power is melee range, you can instead make its range 6 spaces.

name: Divine Fury
description: When you damage a target the first time on a turn with a weapon or unarmed prowess attack, you may deal an extra 1d4 spiritual, light, dark, or necrotic damage. Your state ends if you do not attack a target each round.

name: Divine Inspiration
description: When you make an Intelligence skill roll, you may add your Charisma to the roll as well.

name: Divine Sense
description: Choose 3 creature types. As a quick action, you can sense those creature types, which type they are, and their general number/direction if they're within 60 spaces. This effect persists for 10 minutes or until you enter the dying condition or choose to end it.

name: Divine Sense II
description: Choose 4 creature types. As a quick action, you can sense those creature types, which type they are, and their general number/direction if they're within 120 spaces. This effect persists for 1 hour or until you enter the dying condition or choose to end it.

name: Divine Strikes
description: Once each round, when you deal damage with a weapon attack, you may add +2 spiritual, or necrotic damage to the attack.
req_desc: Power Proficiency of at least 1 and/or at least 1 Power Feat

name: Divine Strikes II
description: Once each round, when you deal damage with a weapon attack, you may add +4 light, dark, spiritual, or necrotic damage to the attack.
req_desc: Power Proficiency of at least 1 and/or at least 2 Power Feats

name: Divine Strikes III
description: Once each round, when you deal damage with a weapon attack, you may add +8 light, dark, spiritual, or necrotic damage to the attack.
req_desc: Power Proficiency of at least 2 and/or at least 3 Power Feats

name: Dodging
description: You may take the Dodge reaction as a free reaction once each round.

name: Dodging Flow
description: When you take the Dodge reaction you gain an additional +1 to your Evasion for that attack. Each time you take the Dodge reaction after the first, gain +2 to your Evasion instead.

name: Reactive
description: Each time you take a reaction after the second time in a round, reduce the additional Reaction's Action Point costs by 1 each.

name: Reactive II
description: Each time you take a reaction after the first time in a round, reduce the additional Reaction's Action Point costs by 1 each.

name: Reactive State
description: Reduce the AP cost of all reactions by 1.

name: Reactive Flow
description: Each time you take a reaction increase your Evasion by 1 until the beginning of your turn.

name: Dreadful Step
description: When you teleport, each creature within 1 space of where you teleport to must roll Mental Fortitude against your Potency or take 1d10 psychic damage. This effect does not occur outside of combat.

name: Dual Wielder
description: While wielding two weapons with the Interchangeable property, add 1/2 of your relevant ability to the damage with the off-hand weapon attack

name: Duck & Weave
description: Increase your Agility by +1 for every two enemies in your Melee Range. This increased Agility does not increase Speed.

name: Dueling
description: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and nothing in the other, increase your Attack rolls, but not damage, with that weapon by +2.

name: Duplicity
description: As a quick action, you may create an illusion of yourself in an unoccupied space within 6 spaces that you can see. This illusion is intangible and can be passed through by objects or creatures; it also mimics your body language exactly. You may use powers and attack as if you were in the illusion's space and not your own. While you are within one space of your illusion, you gain +2 to attack rolls against creatures within one space of both you and your illusion if the target relies on sight. As a quick action, you may move the illusion 6 spaces as long as it remains within 24 spaces of you. This persists for one minute, until you dispel it, or until you enter the dying condition.

name: Duplicity II
description: As a quick action, you may create an illusion of yourself in an unoccupied space within 6 spaces that you can see. This illusion is intangible and can be passed through by objects or creatures; it also mimics your body language exactly. You may use powers and attack as if you were in the illusion's space and not your own. While you are within two spaces of your illusion, you gain +2 to attack rolls against creatures within two spaces of both you and your illusion if the target relies on sight. As a quick action, you may move the illusion 8 spaces as long as it remains within 24 spaces of you, and you may also choose to teleport, swapping places with the illusion. This persists for one minute, until you dispel it, or until you enter the dying condition.

name: Duplicity III
description: As a quick action, you may create an illusion of yourself in an unoccupied space within 6 spaces that you can see. This illusion is intangible and can be passed through by objects or creatures; it also mimics your body language exactly. You may use powers and attack as if you were in the illusion's space and not your own. While you or an ally is within two spaces of your illusion, they gain +2 to attack rolls against creatures within two spaces of both them and your illusion if the target relies on sight. As a free action, you may move the illusion 10 spaces as long as it remains within 30 spaces of you, and you may also choose to teleport, swapping places with the illusion. This persists for one minute, until you dispel it, or until you enter the dying condition. When the illusion ends, any creature of your choice within 1 space of the illusion overheals for an amount equal to your level.

name: Easy Target
description: When you make an attack against a target, you may add +1 to that attack's damage for each round the target has remained in the same location, to a maximum increase of +4.

name: Easy Target II
description: When you make an attack against a target, you may add +2 to that attack's damage for each round the target has remained in the same location, to a maximum increase of +6.

name: Educated Chef
description: When using cook's utensils and at least one fresh ingredient, you may cook for up to 10 allies during any recovery. Creatures who consume this food overheal 5. Must use Intelligence for the Cook skill roll to benefit from this feat.

name: Educated Socialite
description: When you make a Charisma skill roll, you may add 1/2 your Intelligence to the roll.

name: Educated Socialite II
description: When you make a Charisma skill roll you may add your Intelligence to the roll.

name: Elemental Affinity
description: Choose one type of elemental damage. When you use a power that deals that damage, you may add your Power Ability again to the damage.

name: Elemental Attacks
description: When you deal damage with a melee non-power attack, you may choose to add 1d4 of an elemental damage type between lightning, fire, ice, or sonic.

name: Elemental Attacks II
description: When you deal damage with a melee non-power attack, you may choose to add 1d8 of an elemental damage type between lightning, fire, ice, or sonic.

name: Elemental Attacks III
description: When you deal damage with a melee non-power attack, you may choose to add 3d4 of an elemental damage type between lightning, fire, ice, or sonic.

name: Elemental Attacks IV
description: When you deal damage with a melee non-power attack, you may choose to add 2d8 of an elemental damage type between lightning, fire, ice, or sonic.

name: Elemental Bending
description: When using a power that deals elemental damage, you may use another elemental damage you are proficient with instead.

name: Elemental Emanation
description: As a quick action, you may roll a power attack against a creature's Might within 3 spaces. On a success, the target is pushed up to 2 spaces away from you and takes 2d4 elemental damage of your choice between ice, fire, lightning, poison, or acid.

name: Elemental Emanation II
description: As a quick action, you may roll a power attack against a creature's Might within 5 spaces. On a success, the target is pushed up to 3 spaces away from you and takes 2d6 elemental damage of your choice between ice, fire, lightning, poison, or acid.

name: Elemental Resistance
description: Choose one type of elemental damage; you gain resistance to that damage type.

name: Elemental Strike
description: Choose one element. When you damage a target with unarmed prowess, you may choose to change the damage to that type instead once per turn.

name: Elemental Techniques
description: Reduce the Energy cost of Empowered Techniques that have Elemental Damage by 3 to a minimum of 1.

name: Elemental Ward
description: As a quick reaction to create a 2-space radius area of effect centered on your location, giving all creatures in this area resistance to the one elemental damage type that you choose when taking this reaction. This effect persists for one round.

name: Elemental Ward II
description: As a free reaction to create a 3-space radius area of effect centered on your location, giving all creatures in this area resistance to the one elemental damage type that you choose when taking this reaction. This effect persists for one round.

name: Empowered Build
description: Your Strength increases and can exceed the maximum by 3. Choose 4 of your other abilities; they decrease by 1.

name: Empowered Cast
description: When you use a power that deals damage with dice, you may re-roll any number of those dice. You must use the new roll.

name: Empowered Experience
description: When using an empowered technique, you may add half of your level to your roll to hit.
req_desc: Archetype Proficiency of at least 3.

name: Empowered Experience II
description: When using an empowered technique, you may add half of your level to your roll to hit.
req_desc: Archetype Proficiency of at least 4.

name: Empowered Martial
description: When you use a power that has the Add Weapon power part, its lasts on the weapon used for one more round. Power's Energy cost cannot exceed 1/4 of your maximum energy.

name: Empowered Might
description: Increase damage dealt as part of Empowered Techniques by 1d2.

name: Empowered Might II
description: Increase damage dealt as part of Empowered Techniques by 1d4.

name: Empowered Might III
description: Increase damage dealt as part of Empowered Techniques by 1d6.

name: Empowered Rest
description: Regain an additional 1/4 of your Energy once per recovery period (up to a full recovery) provided some of your expended energy came from using an Empowered Technique.

name: Empowered State
description: Add both your Power and Martial Proficiencies to Attacks and Potencies while in this state.

name: Empowered Teacher
description: Choose an creature within 6 spaces, they can immdiately use an Empowered Technique you know, using their own Energy and Action Points instead. The technique can be any Action type but can still be used as a Reaction by the chosen creature. The cost of the technique given cannot exeed half of your Energy maximum.

name: Empowered Techniques
description: Reduce the Energy cost of Empowered Techniques by 2 to a minimum of 1.

name: Empowered Unarmed
description: When determining your Attack Bonus and Damage when using unarmed prowess, you may utilize your entire Archetype Proficiency, not just Martial Proficiency, in calculations.

name: Encouraging Demeanor
description: When a willing creature within 12 spaces has its Evasion targeted by an attack, you may cause it to use a quick reaction and add 1d6 to its Evasion for the turn. Taking this feat again can increase the number of uses or the size of the die by 1d2.

name: Encouraging Demeanor II
description: When a willing creature within 12 spaces has its Evasion targeted by an attack, you may cause it to use a quick reaction and add 1d8 to its Evasion for the turn.

name: Endurance Hiding
description: If you had the Hidden condition for at least 5 minutes before an encounter began, treat your Hide and Stealth scores as being 5 higher until you are detected.

name: Endured Craftsman
description: You spend 12.5% less time crafting anything using Vitality for your Craft Skill or Sub Skill roll.

name: Endured Craftsman II
description: You spend 25% less time crafting anything using Vitality for your Craft Skill or Sub Skill roll.

name: Energy Exchange
description: Once each round, as a free action, you may use Energy to regain a feat's use, or spend a feat's use to regain Energy. For feats with Partial Recovery renewed uses of 1-3, the Energy equivalent is 10 per use; 4-6, it is 6; 7+, it is 4. For feats with Full Recovery renewed uses of 1, the Energy equivalent is 20; 2-3, it is 15; 4-6, it is 12; 7+, it is 8.
req_desc: At least one feat with use(s)

name: Energy Parasite
description: When you deal damage to a creature with a martial attack you may choose to have them make a Power or Martial Attack to Overcome your Potency. On a failed save, the creature loses Energy equal to 1/4 of the damage dealt, and you gain that much energy.

name: Energy Symbiote
description: Once per round, as a free action, you may give another creature with this feat Energy equal to up to 1/4 of your total Energy pool. The Energy flavor should be such that it makes sense the Energy may be shared. Companions cannot have this feat.

name: Enhanced Recovery
description: Receive +1/8 healing from any source.

name: Enlightened Defense
description: As a quick action, you may increase your Evasion by 1/2 your Charisma for a round.

name: Enlightened Defense II
description: As a quick action, you may increase your Evasion by your Charisma for a round.

name: Enlightened State
description: Gain +1 to all Mental Defenses as well as +1 to all Mental Skill rolls. This includes Acuity, Intelligence, and Charisma.

name: Enmity Vow
description: When you attack, you may also choose a creature within 6 spaces. Each martial attack roll you make against the chosen target for the next minute gains +1. If the creature dies before this minute ends, you may choose a different creature within 6 spaces to continue the effect against.

name: Enmity Vow II
description: When you attack, you may also choose a creature within 6 spaces. Each martial attack roll you make against the chosen target for the next minute gains +2. If the creature dies before this minute ends, you may choose a different creature within 6 spaces to continue the effect against.

name: Enmity Vow III
description: When you attack, you may also choose a creature within 6 spaces. Each martial attack roll you make against the chosen target for the next minute gains +2. If the creature makes an attack roll, you may make a martial attack against it as a quick reaction if it is in range. If the creature dies before this minute ends, you may choose a different creature within 6 spaces to continue the effect against.

name: Evasive Footwork
description: When you take the movement action for the second turn in a row, you gain +1 to your Evasion as long as you moved your full Speed on each of those turns. This persists until you are unable to move your entire Speed on your turn.

name: Evasive Footwork II
description: When you take the movement action and move your full Speed with that action you gain +1 to your Evasion. This persists until you are unable to move your at least half of your Speed on your turn.

name: Experienced Endurance
description: Anytime you roll for a skill that could use Vitality but with which you are not proficient, you may add your Vitality to the roll.
req_desc: More than 1 Vitality Skill(s)

name: Experienced Eye
description: When rolling an Acuity skill to perceive or search, if you are looking in a context you have previously encountered, such as a creature, area, environment, or situation, you may treat rolls with that Skill as one Success higher.

name: Experienced Support
description: When using powers that cause a positive effect or enhance a target's capabilities, you may choose to decrease the cost of the power by 4 Energy upon using the Power, to a minimum of 1.

name: Expert Pin
description: When attempting to grapple, you may use Agility instead of Strength whenever relevant.

name: Exploit
description: When attacking a creature with a negative condition, increase your attack roll by +1.

name: Exploit Expert
description: When using powers that cause a negative effect or hinder a target's capabilities, you may choose to decrease the cost of the power by 4 Energy upon using the Power, to a minimum of 1.

name: Exploit Shock
description: When attacking an enemy who hasn't had a turn in combat, your critical multiplier increases by 1 for that attack.

name: Explorer's Endurance
description: You gain +3 to Fortitude when overcoming environmental effects (that occur naturally). such as adverse weather or temperature, elevation, pressure, and so on.

name: Explorer's Endurance II
description: You gain +6 to Fortitude when overcoming environmental effects (that occur naturally). such as adverse weather or temperature, elevation, pressure, and so on.

name: Exponential Growth
description: You may grow by one size category, doubling your height and quadrupling your weight. While grown in this way, you add 1d2 to all damage you deal.

name: Extended Reach
description: Your melee range increases by 1 space when using a weapon with two hands that is two-handed or versitile.

name: Eyes of the Hunt
description: Increase your Acuity by +1 in combat if you have not moved for more than 1 round. Persists until you move.

name: Faith Healer
description: When attempting to help heal or stabilize a creature using Medicine, you may use Religion in place of Medicine or use it as the base skill for Triage.

name: Familiar
description: You have a Companion familar from the creature list or of your own creation using the creature creation rules. If it dies, you may re-summon it or find a new one after completing a Full Recovery. The familiar's level is equal to one-fourth of your own, rounded down, except at levels 1–3, where it follows a progression of 1/4, 1/2, and 3/4, respectively. The highest level the companion may reach is level 1.

name: Familiar II
description: You have a Companion familar from the creature list or of your own creation using the creature creation rules. If it dies, you may re-summon it or find a new one after completing a Full Recovery. The familiar's level is equal to one-fourth of your own, rounded down. The highest level the companion may reach is level 2.

name: Familiar III
description: You have a Companion familar from the creature list or of your own creation using the creature creation rules. If it dies, you may re-summon it or find a new one after completing a Full Recovery. The familiar's level is equal to one-fourth of your own, rounded down. The highest level the companion may reach is level 4.

name: Familiar IV
description: You have a Companion familar from the creature list or of your own creation using the creature creation rules. If it dies, you may re-summon it or find a new one after completing a Full Recovery. The familiar's level is equal to one-fourth of your own, rounded down. The highest level the companion may reach is level 8.

name: Familiar Recall
description: If you have a Companion that has died, you may spend a basic action and at least 15 energy to touch it, bringing it back to 1 Health after one minute.

name: Fanatical Focus
description: When you fail to Overcome something with a Defense you may use a free reaction to add your Strength to the Defense, potentially allowing you to Overcome instead. You may only use this feat once per state.

name: Fast Hands
description: When using Sleight of Hand or any of its Sub Skills, you can treat a successful result as one Success higher.

name: Favored Enemy
description: Choose one creature type. Whenever you make a roll to Analyze, recall history or lore about, or Track a creature of this type, you gain +3 to the roll.

name: Fight
description: When you end your turn in Terminal, you may gain 1 additional Action Point.

name: Find the Chink
description: When attacking a target while you're Hidden, you ignore up to 2 points of Damage Reduction.

name: Fine Art
description: When crafting items using the Art skill you may choose to increase the Difficulty Score to craft by 1 to increase the market currency value by 50%.

name: Flawless Fighter
description: 1-2 on your damage dice are always a 2.

name: Fleeting Feeling
description: Increase your Speed by +2 for every enemy in your Melee Range at the start of your turn. This lasts for one round.

name: Flight
description: While in Terminal, increase your Speed by +1/2.

name: Focus State
description: While focusing on or sustaining a power, you gain +2 to your Evasion and on rolls to maintain focus. Sustain costs 1 less action point per turn to a minimum of 1.

name: Focused Aim
description: When you would fail to Overcome with an attack roll, you may spend 3 Energy to increase the roll by +1 potentially causing it to hit instead. Do this for each 3 Energy you spend, to a maximum of +3 to hit from this feat.

name: Focused Aim II
description: When you would fail to Overcome with an attack roll, you may spend 3 Energy to increase the roll by +1 potentially causing it to hit instead. Do this for each 3 Energy you spend, to a maximum of +5 to hit from this feat.

name: Focused Brutality
description: When you make an attack with a melee weapon, you may choose to decrease your Evasion by 3 for a round and deal 1d10 more damage of the attack's type. You must choose to do this before you roll to attack.

name: Focused Brutality II
description: When you make an attack with a melee weapon, you may choose to decrease your Evasion by 5 for a round and deal 2d10 more damage of the attack's type. Instead you may choose to decrease your Evasion by 2 for a bonus of 1d10 damage instead. You must choose to do this before you roll to attack.

name: Focused Fighting
description: While you maintain focus on or sustain a power, you can make a martial attack using 1 less Action Point once per turn.

name: Focused Summoner
description: When focusing on a Power with a Summon power part, you gain +5 to rolls to maintain focus.

name: Forceful Blow
description: When you deal damage equal to or more than the maximum damage that attack could normally deal, either through feats, powers, techniques, or outside modifers or help, you may choose to push the target back 2 spaces as an interaction. You may also choose to move up to 2 spaces toward the target after knocking it back as part of this interaction.

name: Forceful Challenge
description: When you deal damage to a target for the first time, you may choose to cause that target to have a -2 to hit and damage all targets that are not you for the next minute, targeting Resolve.

name: Forklift
description: You are considered one size larger when determining your carrying capacity.

name: Fortified
description: While in Terminal, increase your VIT by +1/4.

name: Fortified II
description: While in Terminal, increase your VIT by +1/2.

name: Fortified III
description: While in Terminal, double your Vitality.

name: Fortitude of the Wilds
description: Upon aquiring this Feat, choose 3 damage types other than piercing, slashing, and bludgeoning; you are resistant to damage of those types chosen during this state.

name: Free-Blasting
description: As a quick action, you may make a power attack against a creature within 12 spaces, dealing 1d8 magic damage.

name: Friend of Beasts
description: Choose a species of animal or beast such as canine, equine, feline, etc. When rolling Beastcraft with creatures of this species, treat any amount of failures as one success instead.

name: Frightening Critical
description: When an ally within 24 spaces Overcomes (either avoids getting or ends) the Charmed or Frightened condition on themselves, you may use a quick reaction to power attack another creature's Resolve within 24 spaces. On a success, the target gains the same condition that was Overcome, for 1 minute.

name: Frightening Twist
description: When an ally within 24 spaces overcomes an effect that would or already has Charmed or frightened them, you may use a quick reaction to make a power attack against another creature within 24 spaces' Resolve. On a success, that creature becomes charmed or frightened, depending on the condition that was overcome.

name: Frightful Aura
description: When creature(s) start their turn within 2 spaces of you, you may choose to make them roll Resolve against your Potency. If they fail, they become Frightened 2 for one minute. While they are frightened this way, they have -2 to their Evasion. After Overcoming this effect, creatures cannot become frightened again this way for two rounds.

name: Gestalt Entity
description: You no longer need to eat, drink, or breathe.

name: Getting Cocky
description: Each time you reduce a creature to 0 Health, increase your Charisma by +1 for two rounds, to a maximum of +3 from this feat.

name: Glorious Rest
description: When you finish a recovery, you may overheal a number of Health equal to half your level plus half your archetype ability. 5 creatures of your choice who were part of that rest may overheal Health equal to 1/4 your level.

name: Glorious Rest II
description: When you finish a recovery, you may overheal a number of Health equal to your level plus your archetype ability. 5 creatures of your choice who were part of that rest may overheal Health equal to half your level.

name: Go for Broke
description: You may choose to gain +3 to an ability for one round. When the round ends, you have -3 on all D20 rolls for the next round.

name: Goading Strength
description: You may use Strength instead of Charisma to determine your Taunt Skill Bonus.

name: Granted State
description: When you activate this state you may choose a creature who can see or hear you within 12 spaces to gain this state instead. As part of the same action you can spend 2 state uses to activate it on yourself as well.

name: Grasping Ground
description: As a basic action, you may roll a power attack against the Might of each creature of your choice within 6 spaces. On a success, affected creatures gain the Immobile condition for one minute.

name: Guarded Mind
description: You have resistance to psychic damage. When you have the charmed or frightened condition, you can end it on yourself with a quick action.
tags: Psychic Damage Resistance,Charm Immunity,Frighten Immunity,Quick Action

name: Guided Strike
description: When you or a creature within 12 spaces fails an attack roll, you may grant it +6 to that attack roll as a quick reaction. If you use this effect for yourself, it takes no reaction.

name: Guided Strike II
description: When you or a creature within 18 spaces fails an attack roll, you may grant it +7 to that attack roll as a quick reaction. If you use this effect for yourself, it takes no reaction.

name: Guided Strike III
description: When you or a creature within 24 spaces fails an attack roll, you may grant it +8 to that attack roll as a free reaction. If you use this effect for yourself, it takes no reaction.

name: Hamstring Blow
description: When you deal damage equal to or more than the maximum damage that attack could normally deal, you may choose to give the target the Slow 2 condition for 1 minute using your potency to Overcome on subsequent turns.

name: Harder Hit
description: Increase the damage of any technique upon performing it by spending +1 Energy for each +1d2 to a maximum of +1d6.

name: Harder Hit II
description: Increase the damage of any technique upon performing it by spending +1 Energy for each +1d2 to a maximum of +1d12.

name: Hardy Drinker
description: Increase your Fortitude by +6 when Overcoming effects of ingested substances.

name: Harm or Heal
description: You may spend a basic action to target a creature within 6 spaces and Heal it for 1d8 or, targeting its Fortitude, deal it 1d8 Light, Dark, Necrotic, or Spiritual damage on a success and half as much on a failure.

name: Harm or Heal II
description: You may spend a basic action to target a creature within 6 spaces and Heal it for 1d10 or, targeting its Fortitude, deal it 1d10 Light, Dark, Necrotic, or Spiritual damage on a success and half as much on a failure.

name: Harm or Heal III
description: You may spend a quick action or basic reaction to target a creature within 8 spaces and Heal it for 1d10 or, targeting its Fortitude, deal it 1d10 Light, Dark, Necrotic, or Spiritual damage on a success and half as much on a failure.

name: Healer
description: Whenever you roll dice to determine an amount healed by you to another, you may add your power proficiency to the healed amount once for each 1d12 equivalent of dice rolled (2d6, 3d4, etc., count as 1d12 equivalent).

name: Healer II
description: Whenever you roll dice to determine an amount healed by you to another, you may add your Power Bonus to the healed amount once for each 1d12 equivalent of dice rolled (2d6, 3d4, etc., count as 1d12 equivalent).

name: Healing Burst
description: You may use a basic action to cause a number of targets, including yourself, equal to your power ability within 12 spaces which can see or hear you to overheal 2d6 Health.

name: Healing Reserves
description: As a quick action, you may heal a creature within 6 spaces that you can see for a number of d4s. You have a pool of d4s equal to the uses of this feat.

name: Healing Reserves II
description: As a quick action, you may heal a creature within 6 spaces that you can see for a number of d4s. You have a pool of d4s equal to the uses of this feat.

name: Healing Reserves III
description: As a quick action or reaction, you may heal a creature within 6 spaces that you can see for a number of d4s. You have a pool of d4s equal to the uses of this feat.

name: Health Exchange
description: Once each round, as a free action, you may use Health to regain a feat's use. For feats with Partial Recovery renewed uses of 1-3, the Health equivalent is 12; 4-6, it is 8; 7+, it is 6. For feats with Full Recovery renewed uses of 1, the Health equivalent is 22; 2-3, it is 17; 4-6, it is 14; 7+, it is 10.
req_desc: At least one feat with use(s)

name: Heavy Hitter
description: When you deal damage equal to 25% of a target's Health in one attack, you apply Stun 1 for one minute, if it's equal to 50% Health you apply Stun 2 for one minute instead. The target uses Fortitude to Overcome your Potency on subsequent turns.

name: Heavy Moving
description: You can pull, push, shove, or heave items of at most double your carrying capacity a number of spaces equal to one half of your Athletic skill bonus as an interaction.

name: Heightened Focus
description: As a free reaction, you may add your Intelligence to a roll made to maintain focus. To use this feat you cannot be wearing armor or wielding a shield or weapon with a Strength requirement

name: Heroic Resilience
description: During an encounter when you start your turn in Terminal, you heal an amount equal to your 1/2 of your Vitality.

name: Heroic Resilience II
description: During an encounter when you start your turn in Terminal, you heal an amount equal to your Vitality.

name: Heroic Resilience III
description: During an encounter when you start your turn in Terminal, you heal an amount equal to double your Vitality.

name: Hexxing
description: When you reduce a creature's Ability by any amount, its Defense for that Ability decreases by an extra -1 for each -1 applied to the Ability. If you reduce a Defense directly (without affecting the Ability), apply an extra -1. If you reduce a Skill, double the reduction.

name: Hidden Natural Weapons
description: As a quick action, you can grow a natural weapon for 1 minute. It deals 1d8 slashing, bludgeoning, or piercing damage, uses Strength for attack and damage, and you are proficient with it. If proficient in unarmed prowess, you may treat it as an unarmed prowess and may use Agility instead, and add +1d4 to your normal unarmed prowess damage instead.

name: Hidden Natural Weapons II
description: As a quick action, you can grow a natural weapon for 1 minute. It deals 1d10 slashing, bludgeoning, or piercing damage, uses Strength for attack and damage, and you are proficient with it. If proficient in unarmed prowess, you may treat it as an unarmed prowess and may use Agility instead, and add +1d6 to your normal unarmed prowess damage instead.

name: Hidden Natural Weapons III
description: As a quick action, you can grow a natural weapon for 1 minute. It deals 1d12 slashing, bludgeoning, or piercing damage, uses Strength for attack and damage, and you are proficient with it. If proficient in unarmed prowess, you may treat it as an unarmed prowess and may use Agility instead, and add +1d8 to your normal unarmed prowess damage instead.

name: Hidden Messages
description: Choose an organization, similar archetype to your own, or other group of people. You may spend a minute to create hidden messages in semi-visible locations that only that group can decipher and spot. An investigation skill roll DS equal to your level + 10 can find the message but cannot interpret it.

name: Historian
description: When you fail a History skill roll you treat the Failure as one Success more.

name: Hit ‘em while they're down
description: When you hit a prone target with an attack, roll 1d10. On a 9-10 treat the hit as a Critical hit.

name: Hit Em' Where They're Weak
description: Decrease your critical range by 3 against terminal foes.

name: Honed Reflexes
description: When you would be affected by an area of effect power or ability that targets your Reflexes, you take no damage if you succeed the defense roll, and half damage if you fail.

name: Horde Breaker
description: When you make an attack against a creature within 1 space, you may use a quick action to make another attack against a different creature within 1 space of that creature. Reduce the multiple action penalty for the second attack by 3.

name: Hyperextend
description: You may gain 1 action point with no action, also gaining a level of exhaustion that cannot be reduced or prevented in any way.

name: Hysteria
description: Your Strength increases by +1 for every 2 enemies in your melee range.

name: I'm Not Dead Yet!
description: When in Terminal, increase all rolls to Overcome by +2.

name: I've Got the High Ground
description: When attacking a target that is one space or more below you, increase your attack roll by +3.

name: Ignorance is Bliss
description: You may increase your Charisma by +1 and decrease your Acuity by the same amount for each use of this feat used, for one round.
req_desc: Intelligence of at most 0

name: Ignorance is Bliss II
description: You may increase your Charisma by +2 and decrease your Acuity by the same amount for each use of this feat used, for one round.
req_desc: Intelligence of at most 0

name: Ignorance is Bliss III
description: You may increase your Charisma by +2 and decrease your Acuity by the same amount for each use of this feat used, for one round.
req_desc: Intelligence of at most 0

name: Illusion to Reality
description: When you use a non-innate power with an Illusion part, you can choose one inanimate, non magical object that is part of the illusion and make that object real as a quick action. The object remains real for 1 minute, during which it cannot deal damage or cause any conditions or effects.

name: Immovable Force
description: When you would be affected by an area of effect power or ability that targets your Might, you take no damage if you succeed the defense roll, and half damage if you fail.

name: Impasta
description: When crafting consumables using the Cook Skill you may add negative Power effects or poison damage costing up to 6 Energy for free with the requirement that it must be ingested by a creature to take effect.

name: Impenetrable
description: When wearing armor with a Vulnerability property and taking that damage type, you may apply the armor's regular damage reduction to that damage.

name: Impenetrable II
description: When wearing armor with a Vulnerability property and taking that damage type, you may apply the armor's regular damage reduction to that damage.

name: Expose to Power
description: When you deal damage to a creature with a martial attack increase your Power Potency and Power Bonus by 3 the next time you attack the target with a Power.

name: Impressive Presence
description: When you fail a Charisma skill roll, you may use a quick reaction to re-roll and take the new result. Once this turns a failure into a success, it counts as a use of this feat.

name: Impressive Presence II
description: When you fail a Charisma skill roll, you may use a quick reaction to re-roll and take the new result. Once this turns a failure into a success, it counts as a use of this feat.

name: Improvise
description: Remove or reduce 1 technique part from a technique upon performing it. You don't pay the Energy cost for said part. (This does not permanently remove technique parts, only upon performing.)

name: Improvise II
description: Remove or reduce up to 2 technique parts from a technique upon performing it. You don't pay the Energy cost for said parts. (This does not permanently remove technique parts, only upon performing.)

name: Improvised Forgery
description: You may attempt to forge items even if you have only a little knowledge of what the original documents look like. The Difficulty Score for this type of forgery cannot be higher than 20.

name: In a Rhythm
description: As a quick action, you gain +2 to all Charisma-based skill rolls for 10 minutes.

name: In Tune
description: You can understand any language when it is spoken. Creatures that can understand any language can understand you when you speak in any language.
req_desc: At least 7 total between all mental abilities.

name: Inborn Power
description: You gain +1 to your Power Bonus and Potency when using Innate Powers.

name: Incorporeal
description: While in the form, you have -5 to all physical d20 rolls and defenses and cannot use non-innate powers or techniques. You are resistant to all damage types other than spiritual and have a flying speed equal to 1/2 your speed up to a height of 3 spaces.

name: Indomitable
description: When your defense is overcome, you can add an amount equal to your level to the score or roll to potentially change the outcome.

name: Indomitable II
description: When your defense is overcome, you can add an amount equal to your level to the score or roll to potentially change the outcome.

name: Indomitable III
description: When your defense is overcome, you can add an amount equal to your level to the score or roll to potentially change the outcome.

name: Indomitable Might
description: When you would fail a Strength skill or defense roll, you may choose to use the score as the rolled value instead.

name: Indomitable Might II
description: When you would fail a Strength skill or defense roll, you may choose to use the score as the rolled value instead.

name: Innate Blasts
description: The damage dealt by your innate powers (if any) is increased by your power ability.

name: Innate Empowered Technique
description: Your innate powers can be empowered techniques.

name: Innate Martial
description: You can have an innate technique costing no energy provided its energy cost is at or below 4, it takes a basic action or reaction, and has no energy gain or healing parts.

name: Insane Vitality
description: Your Vitality increases and can exceed the maximum by 4. Choose 4 of your other abilities; they decrease by 1.

name: Inspire
description: As a quick action, you may grant a creature who can see or hear you an inspiration die. This inspiration die is 1d6, which the creature can use whenever they fail a d20 roll or when an effect overcomes their defense to add to the roll/score, potentially causing it to succeed/fail. A creature can only have 1 inspiration die at a time. The die lasts for an hour or until used.

name: Inspire II
description: As a quick action, you may grant a creature who can see or hear you an inspiration die. This inspiration die is 1d8, which the creature can use whenever they fail a d20 roll or when an effect overcomes their defense to add to the roll/score, potentially causing it to succeed/fail. A creature can only have 1 inspiration die at a time. The die lasts for an hour or until used.

name: Inspire III
description: As a quick action, you may grant a creature who can see or hear you an inspiration die. This inspiration die is 1d10, which the creature can use whenever they fail a d20 roll or when an effect overcomes their defense to add to the roll/score, potentially causing it to succeed/fail. A creature can only have 1 inspiration die at a time. The die lasts for an hour or until used.

name: Inspire IV
description: As a quick action, you may grant a creature who can see or hear you an inspiration die. This inspiration die is 1d12, which the creature can use whenever they fail a d20 roll or when an effect overcomes their defense to add to the roll/score, potentially causing it to succeed/fail. A creature can only have 1 inspiration die at a time. The die lasts for an hour or until used.

name: Invigorating Inspiration
description: As a basic action, you may give each ally who can see or hear you within 6 spaces Health or Energy equal to your level.

name: Inspiring Leader
description: Gain a +3 bonus to Persuade or Motivate skill rolls when encouraging allies.

name: Inspiring Maneuver
description: When you perform a technique costing more than or equal to 10 Energy, you may distribute overheal Health to creatures of your choice within 6 spaces. The number of Health you can distribute is equal to 2d4 plus 1/2 your level.

name: Instinctive Arcanist
description: When using the Power Improvisation Action you may treat a failed Power Improvisation Roll as one Success higher.

name: Instinctive Incision
description: Increase your Attack Rolls by +2 against one enemy of your choice that moved in the last round.

name: Instinctive Observer
description: Each time a trigger allows you to take the Detect Reaction, you can do so without Action Point cost.

name: Intervention
description: You may use a power on your turn that costs equal to or less than 35 without spending any Energy.

name: Intervention II
description: You may use a power on your turn that costs equal to or less than 80 without spending any Energy.

name: Intimidating Physique
description: Add 1/2 of your Strength to Intimidate rolls.

name: Intimidating Physique II
description: Add your Strength to Intimidate rolls.

name: Intimidating Presence
description: As a quick action, you may roll Intimidation against each creature of your choice within 6 spaces of you. If your roll equals or exceeds their Resolve score(s), the target(s) gains the Frightened 2 condition for 1 minute, rolling against your Intimidate Score to overcome on subsequent turns.

name: Intimidating Presence II
description: As a quick action, you may roll Intimidation against each creature of your choice within 6 spaces of you. If your roll equals or exceeds their Resolve score(s), the target(s) gains the Frightened 3 condition for 1 minute, rolling against your Intimidate Score to overcome on subsequent turns.

name: Intimidating Stance
description: As a basic action, you can roll Intimidate. Target creature that can see or hear you within 6 spaces whose Resolve is less than your Intimidate roll gains the Weakened condition with a level equal to half your Intimidate Bonus.

name: Intimidating Stance II
description: As a basic action, you can roll Intimidate. Up to two target creatures that can see or hear you within 6 spaces whose Resolve is less than your Intimidate roll gains the Weakened condition with a level equal to half your Intimidate Bonus.

name: Invasive Attack
description: When you hit a target with an attack, you remove its resistance to one damage type or make it vulnerable to one damage type for 5 rounds. You can choose to apply this effect before dealing damage.

name: Invisible Insight
description: When rolling insight, you may do so with no penalty or difficulty score increase due to creature's being unseen by you when rolling, or if seen, unheard instead.

name: Jack of All Trades
description: If you are unproficient with a skill, you may add +1 to skill rolls made with that skill.

name: Jack of All Trades II
description: If you are unproficient with a skill, you may add +2 to skill rolls made with that skill.

name: Jump into Action
description: Whenever you enter a state, you may move up to half of your movement for free.

name: Keen Observer
description: When you fail a Perceive roll you may choose to roll again and take the higher result.

name: Keep it Together
description: Outside of combat, you may ignore the effects of any negative conditions affecting you for 1 hour.

name: Keep it Together II
description: Outside of combat, you may ignore the effects of any negative conditions affecting you for 1 hour.

name: Kiting
description: Once per round, when an enemy moves within 1 space of you, you can use a free reaction to move up to 2 spaces. Each additional use in the same round costs a quick reaction.

name: Knowledgeable Surgeon
description: When you make a Medicine or Triage skill check to restore Health, you may spend an Action Point to gain a bonus to the roll equal to your Intelligence. You may only do this once per roll.

name: Last Minute Luck
description: As a quick reaction to being hit by an attack, you may cause the attack to miss instead. You may do so after knowing the damage the attack would deal if any.

name: Last Second Dodge
description: When you would be affected by an area of effect but you are located within one space of the border of its area, you may use a quick reaction to move outside of the area and avoid being affected.

name: Last Stand
description: When damage would reduce you to 0 Health or less, you may use a free reaction to return a 2 AP or less attack. If the target falls to 0 Health or below as a result, you ignore the damage they dealt to you this turn.

name: Lasting Veil
description: You may use a quick action to give yourself the Invisible condition for 1 hour. This invisibility ends if you take any action to directly harm a target, whether through damage or negative effects.

name: Lasting Veil II
description: You may use a quick action to give yourself the Invisible condition for 1 hour per use of this feat. This invisibility ends if you take any action to directly harm a target, whether through damage or negative effects.

name: Lay on Hands
description: As a quick action, you may heal yourself or a creature within 1 space. The amount healed is pulled from a pool of Health equal to 3 times your level, you choose how much of this pool to use. Regain this pool on a partial recovery.

name: Lay on Hands II
description: As a quick action, you may heal yourself or a creature within 1 space. The amount healed is pulled from a pool of Health equal to 3 times your level, you choose how much of this pool to use. You may spend 5 points to remove a condition from the creature instead of healing it. If this is a leveled condition, you remove levels of this condition equal to your archetype proficiency. You may spend 5 points per condition in the same quick action if there is more than one condition affecting the creature or if you want to reduce a leveled condition more. Regain this pool on a partial recovery.

name: Lay on Hands III
description: As a quick action, you may heal yourself or a creature within 1 space.
