The amount healed is pulled from a pool of Health equal to 4 times your level, you choose how much of this pool to use. You may spend 5 points to remove a condition from the creature instead of healing it. If this is a leveled condition, you remove levels of this condition equal to your archetype proficiency. You may spend 5 points per condition in the same quick action if there is more than one condition affecting the creature or if you want to reduce a leveled condition more. Regain this pool on a partial recovery.

name: Lay on Hands VI
description: As a quick action, you may heal yourself or a creature within 1 space. The amount healed is pulled from a pool of Health equal to 5 times your level, you choose how much of this pool to use. You may spend 5 points to remove a condition from the creature instead of healing it. If this is a leveled condition, you remove levels of this condition equal to your archetype proficiency. You may spend 5 points per condition in the same quick action if there is more than one condition affecting the creature or if you want to reduce a leveled condition more. Regain this pool on a partial recovery.

name: Leading Evasion
description: When an effect would target you and at least one other creature's Reflex or Evasion, you may use a quick reaction to add your Agility to their defense. The allied creature must be able to see or hear you; this effect can only apply to one other creature at a time.

name: Leap to Your Feet
description: You may stand from Prone as a free action with no movement required.

name: Learned Advisor
description: When an ally is using a skill you don't have proficiency in, you may still take the help action using half your Intelligence to calculate the help die size.

name: Learned Scholar
description: Choose one power part type (charm, control, adaptation, etc.). Gaining proficiency with this category of power parts requires half the normal Training Points.

name: Lengthened Power
description: When you use a power that has a duration longer than 1, you may double the duration, to a maximum of 24 hours.

name: Life-Giving State
description: At the start of your turn, you may choose a creature within 2 spaces other than you. That creature overheals a number of Health equal to 1/4 your level.

name: Lifedrinker
description: When you deal damage with a martial attack, you may roll 1d4 and heal that much, to a maximum of the damage dealt by that attack.

name: Limitless
description: Once per round, you may use a use of a Partial Recovery feat without spending that use. Once per combat, you may use a use of a Full Recovery feat without spending that use.

name: Linguist
description: Learn 2 additional languages. The time it takes you to learn a new language is halved.

name: Long-Lasting State
description: Your state now lasts up to 10 minutes and cannot be ended by any effect, other than feat imposed restrictions, death or if you choose to end it.
req_desc: At least 2 state feats

name: Lycanthropy
description: While in this state, you gain a +1 to unarmed prowess or natural weapon damage. If you take a hit that deals 1/4th of your max Health, you must make a Potency 8 Resolve roll. On a failure, you lose control for a round where the RM takes control of your character.

name: Lycanthropy II
description: While in this form, you gain a +2 to unarmed prowess or natural weapon damage. Additionally, you reduce 2 damage taken from all physical attacks from non-silvered weapons. If you take a hit that deals 1/4th of your max Health, you must make a Potency 8 Resolve roll. On a failure, you lose control for a round where the RM takes control of your character. To use this feat you must not be wearing armor with a strength requirement of 3 or more.

name: Lycanthropy III
description: While in this form, you gain a +3 to unarmed prowess or natural weapon damage. Additionally, you reduce 3 damage taken from all attacks from non-silvered weapons. Additionally, when you make an unarmed attack on your turn, you may spend a quick action to make another unarmed attack. To use this feat you must not be wearing armor with a strength requirement of 3 or more.

name: Magic-Martial Attack
description: When you make a martial attack or use a power with a basic action, you may immediately make another martial attack or use a power (with an action cost of a basic action or less) with a quick action. The quick action is still affected by the multiple action penalty. After doing so, you cannot make attacks until the beginning of your next turn.

name: Magic-Martial Attack II
description: When you make a martial attack or use a power with a basic action, you may immediately make another martial attack or use a power (with an action cost of a basic action or less) with a quick action. The quick action does not inflict the multiple action penalty. After doing so, you cannot make attacks until the beginning of your next turn.

name: Good First Impression
description: Gain a +3 bonus to Persude and Charm rolls against someone you met within 24 hours.

name: Make it Count
description: While in Terminal, increase your Acuity by +1/4.

name: Make it Count II
description: While in Terminal, increase your Acuity by +1/2.

name: Make it Count III
description: While in Terminal, double your Acuity.

name: Make it Worth it
description: When you attack a creature that hasn't had a turn in combat, you gain +5 to attacks and damage. If it's only had one turn in combat instead, you gain +1.

name: Malicious Mimic
description: When using a technique with the command part, you may target an enemy with that part, rolling Deceive -5 against their Discernment, causing them to obey your command using the granted action points on a success. The command cannot cause them or their allies direct harm.
req_desc: Proficiency with the Command Technique part.

name: Malleable Form
description: You may choose to have you form become malleable for one minute, allowing you to pass through spaces as small as 5 cm. During this time you may also use a quick action to lose the Grappled, Restrained, or Immobile condition(s).

name: Malleable Form II
description: You may choose to have your form become malleable for one minute, allowing you to pass through spaces as small as 5 cm. During this time you may also use a free action to lose the Grappled, Restrained, or Immobile condition(s).

name: Manifest Mind
description: While within 6 spaces of a Companion, you may use a power through it using a free action (in addition to the action required to cast), using the power as if it was used from the Companion instead. The Power still uses your Power Bonus and Potency, requires your focus and sustatin, and so on.

name: Mantle of Dominion
description: You may use a power with only General and Charm power parts and with an energy cost equal to or less than 12 without spending energy. If you target a creature who is already charmed by you with this power, the power takes effect without needing to overcome a defense. You may regain a use of this feat by spending 6 Energy.

name: Mark of Bane
description: Once per turn, when you attack a creature that is affected by a power you used, you may deal damage to another creature within 6 spaces of that creature equal to your power bonus.

name: Marked
description: When you make an attack roll against a creature that is currently affected by a power you used, you gain +2 to the attack roll.

name: Martial Power Combination
description: Immediately after using an innate power, you may make a weapon attack as a quick action. This still incurs the multiple action penalty as normal unless done with a weapon that has the "interchangeable" property, in which case the attack is treated as an off-hand dual-wielding attack.

name: Mask of the Wilds
description: When obscured by foliage or natural terrain, you have one level of obscurity higher.

name: Massive Heal
description: As a basic action, you may divide 25 Health and heal all creatures of your choice within 6 spaces for amounts equal to your choosing.

name: Massive Heal II
description: As a basic action, you may divide 50 Health and heal all creatures of your choice within 6 spaces for amounts equal to your choosing.

name: Master of Death
description: When you would gain the dying condition, you may spend 1/2 of the remainder of your Energy and go to 1 Health instead.
req_desc: Energy maximum of at least 30

name: Method Acting
description: Your ability to assume different personas and convincingly portray characters grants you a +2 bonus to Deceive or Act rolls when disguising yourself or assuming a role that is not your own.

name: Master of Disguise
description: You may spend 1 minute to disguise yourself in a way that makes you look almost identical to a creature of similar bodily makeup to you and of your same size. A creature can roll Discernment to see through your disguise against your Act or Perform score if they suspect you. The suspect you if their Discernment score is equal to or above your Act or Perform Score, or for another reason.

name: Master Poisoner
description: When you deal poison damage to a creature, that damage ignores any resistance to poison. Once per turn, when you deal poison damage to a creature, it also applies Weakened 1 for one round.

name: Mighty
description: While in this state, you gain +2 to your Might and Strength skill rolls.

name: Mimic
description: Can mimic any sound heard exactly, including voices. When using Act and mimicing a sound or voice you consider rolls one Success higher.

name: Mind Palace
description: You may take 10 additional minutes before making any Intelligence skill roll if you have the time provided and relative silence. After this time, treat the roll as one Success higher.

name: Mind Rend
description: When you deal psychic damage to a creature and achieve a critical hit, the creature must roll Mental Fortitude or become Stunned 2 for one minute using your Potency.

name: Mind Scrivener
description: You may choose one power in your power list totaling no more than 1/8 of your Energy. You may cast this power as if innate and increase the damage by up to +1d8. For a non-damage power part, you may add power parts with a total cost below 9 Energy (including increases) to the power.

name: Mind Smite
description: When you hit a creature with a martial attack, you may add 1d8 psychic damage to the attack as a free action.

name: Mindless State
description: You have immunity to the Charmed and Frightened conditions while in this state. If you're Charmed or Frightened when you activate your state feat, the condition ends on you.

name: Miraculous Luck
description: When you fail a d20 roll, you may treat it as a natural 20 instead.

name: Mis-Haggle Mitigation
description: When rolling the Haggle skill treat any failure as one degree less, and partial failure as partial success.

name: Mobile Attacker
description: When attacking more than once in one turn, you may move 2 spaces. You may take this movement as part of a subsequent attack.

name: Mobile Evasion
description: When wearing no armor and wielding no shield, gain +1 to your Evasion.

name: Momentum
description: When you take the Move action for the second time in a turn and move your entire movement in one direction, you regain 1 Action Point.

name: Momentum Teleportation
description: When you make more than one martial attack in a round, you may teleport 6 spaces to a location that you can see immediately after the second attack.

name: Monk Accuracy
description: When you would miss an attack with a monk weapon, you may spend an free action to re-roll the attack roll, using the result.
req_desc: Monk Weaponry Feat

name: Monk Weapon Defense
description: If you make an unarmed prowess attack not with a monk weapon but while holding a monk weapon, you gain +1 to your Evasion for one round. This effect cannot stack.
req_desc: Monk Weaponry Feat

name: Monk Weaponry
description: Choose weapon(s) whose proficiency cost is a total of 12 Training Points or less, with no one above 4. Each weapon you are proficient with this way counts as unarmed prowess for the sake of applying to feats. You may choose ranged weapons.
req_desc: Weapons must be one-handed and have at least two weapon properties between Finesse, Quick, Thrown, Versatile, or Interchangeable.

name: Motivation
description: When using a technique that targets one creature and the attack misses, you recover 1/4 of the Energy spent.

name: Motivation II
description: When using a technique that targets one creature and the attack misses, you recover 1/2 of the Energy spent.

name: Motivational Fighter
description: When you achieve a Critical Hit, two creatures of your choice that can see you gain 1 Action Point.

name: Mounted Concentration
description: Decrease Energy cost of powers by 3 when on a mount (minimum of 2 Energy).

name: Mounted Precision
description: Increase Acuity by +1 while on a mount.

name: Mounted Warrior
description: Increase all damage dealt by 1d4 while on a mount.

name: Mounted Warrior II
description: Increase all damage dealt by 1d6 while on a mount.

name: Multi-Attack
description: When you make a martial attack with a basic action, you may immediately make another martial attack with a quick action. This cannot be a technique or power attack, and does not inflict the multiple action penalty. After doing so, you cannot make attacks until the beginning of your next turn.

name: Multi-Attack II
description: When you make a martial attack with a basic action, you may immediately make another martial attack with a quick action. This can be unarmed prowess and does not inflict the multiple action penalty. After doing so, you cannot make attacks until the beginning of your next turn.

name: Multi-Attack III
description: When you make a martial attack with a basic action or as part of a technique with a basic or quick action, you may immediately make another martial attack with a quick action. This can be unarmed prowess and does not inflict the multiple action penalty.

name: Multiattack Defense
description: You gain 2 Evasion for each additional time you are attacked this turn.

name: Multitasker
description: When you take the interaction action, you may take it again once for free on the same turn. These actions may be taken separately from each other and between other actions.

name: Must've Been the Wind
description: When you attack with a finesse weapon while Hidden, you may reduce the damage of that attack by 1d6 (to a minimum of 0) to give -5 to all Detect reactions taken in response, even if you miss. You must end your turn Heavily or Completely Obscured for this effect to occur.
req_desc: Proficiency with Finesse property

name: Must've Been the Wind II
description: When you attack with a finesse weapon while Hidden, you may reduce the damage of that attack by 1d6 (to a minimum of 0) to give -8 to all Detect reactions taken in response, even if you miss. You must end your turn Heavily or Completely Obscured for this effect to occur.
req_desc: Proficiency with Finesse property

name: Nature's Protection
description: You gain resistance to poison damage and one other elemental damage type of your choice between fire, ice, and lightning.

name: Nimble
description: You can move through difficult terrain requiring only 1 space of Movement Speed for every other space in rough terrain (starting at the first).

name: Nimble II
description: You can move through difficult terrain without spending additional spaces of movement.

name: Noxious Potency
description: Increase your potency when applying the Weakened effect by +1.

name: Noxious Potency II
description: Increase your potency when applying the Weakened effect by +2.

name: Off-Guard
description: After you achieve a critical hit, your target gains a -2 to all defenses and defense rolls for one round.

name: Omen
description: Make a 1d4 roll at the end of a full recovery. On even, you may use a free reaction to add 1d8 to an ally's d20 roll or defense if they can see or hear you. On odd, you may use a free reaction to decrease a creature's d20 roll or defense by 1d8. You may use the effect related to the outcome a number of times equal to this feat's uses.

name: One Focus
description: Choose one power that requires focus. You can no longer lose focus while mainting focus with that power.

name: One Heart One Mind
description: After a Full Recovery, choose a Companion. All of your senses are connected to them, and theirs to yours. You can sense what they sense, and they can sense what you sense.

name: One Man Army
description: Increase all abilities by +1 when no ally is within 12 spaces of you.

name: One Step Ahead
description: After completing a full recovery, roll a d20 and record the result. You may replace any future d20 roll with the recorded result. You must choose to do this before knowing the result of the roll, in order to replace it.

name: One Warrior
description: When mounted you or your mount's Evasion increases to be equal to the higher Evasion between the two of you.

name: Opportunist
description: When an enemy within your Melee Range is hit by an attack, you may use a Basic Reaction to attack that creature with a basic action attack.

name: Opportunistic Grapple
description: When you achieve a critical hit and have a free hand, you may attempt to grapple the target as part of that same action with no multiple action penalty.

name: Opportunistic Pickpocket
description: When a creature makes an Attack against you while within 1 space you may use a quick reaction and an interaction to either lift one of their belongings or plant an object on their person using a successful Pickpocket skill roll against their Discernment

name: Opportunistic Repositioning
description: When you use a use of any other feat, you may move up to 1/2 of your speed for free.

name: Overextend
description: You may choose to gain 1 action point as a free action or free reaction, but the next time you regain action points, you gain one less.

name: Overextend II
description: You may choose to gain 1-2 action points as a free action or free reaction, but the next time you regain a corresponding amount less.

name: Overpower
description: When you use a power that deals damage with dice, you may have half of those dice deal maximum damage instead.

name: Overpower II
description: When you use a power that deals damage with dice, you may have all of those dice deal maximum damage instead.

name: Overpower III
description: When you use a power that deals damage with dice, you may have all of those dice deal maximum damage instead.

name: Overprepared
description: Choose one feat, whenever you roll initiative you regain half the uses of that feat, rounded down. You may choose a different feat each partial recovery.

name: Overwhelming Attack
description: If a creature is hit with 2 or more attacks in the same turn, one or more being from you, you may make Strength or Agility attack roll with no MAP against its choice of Reflexes or Might to knock it Prone or back 3 spaces. Alternatively, you may make an attack roll against its Vitality to cause it to become Dazed for two rounds.

name: Pacifist
description: Receive double healing from all outside sources; all damage you deal is halved. Outside sources include healing as the result of other creatures or ingestion of healing consumables.

name: Paired Minds
description: As a quick action, you may choose a creature that you can see within 6 spaces. They can communicate telepathically with you, and you with them, for a number of minutes equal to your archetype ability, as long as you remain within a number of kilometers of each other equal to twice your archetype ability.

name: Party Scout
description: When rolling Initiative, you may choose to give another creature that can see or hear you +5 on their Initiative roll. If that creature would become surprised this encounter, they do not instead.

name: Passive Intimidation
description: Increase your Intimidate Score by your Strength or Vitality. When interacting with you for the first time a creature who can see you must first roll Resolve against this Score, becoming intimidated on a failure. (in a way as interpreted by a Realm Master)
req_desc: Strength or Vitality of at least 1,

name: Peerless Athlete
description: You may use a basic action to increase your jump distances by 2 spaces and increase all Strength Skill rolls by +2 for one hour.

name: Peerless Skill
description: When you fail a skill or ability roll, you may roll 1d8 and add the result to the roll, potentially changing the outcome. If you still fail, you do not spend a use of this feat.

name: Penny Weaponry
description: You may craft weapons at 25% of the regular material cost, but which break after dealing five times their maximum dice roll in damage (eg., 1d4 weapon breaks after dealing 20 damage). You may craft these weapons using the Glassblowing skill and tools.
req_desc: Proficiency in the Glassblowing or Smithing sub-skill

name: People Reader
description: Add your Acuity to Insight rolls.

name: Personal Best
description: You may increase your Strength by 1 for a round, but you gain 1 level of exhaustion when doing so. At the start of your turn, you may choose to maintain this for another round, but gain an additional level of exhaustion each time you do.

name: Personal Best II
description: You may increase your Strength by 1 or 2 for a round, but you gain an equal level of exhaustion when doing so. At the start of your turn, you may choose to maintain this for another round, but gain a corresponding level of exhaustion each time you do.

name: Personal Best III
description: You may increase your Strength by 2 for a round, but you gain 1 level of exhaustion when doing so. At the start of your turn, you may choose to maintain this for another round, but gain an additional level of exhaustion each time you do.

name: Phase Step
description: Once per turn, as a quick action, you may teleport 6 spaces to a location that you can see.

name: Phase Step II
description: Once per turn, as a quick action, you may teleport 12 spaces to a location that you can see.

name: Phase Step III
description: As a quick action, you and a willing ally within 2 spaces may choose a location within 12 spaces that you can see; you and your ally teleport to or within 1 space of that location.

name: Pinnacle of Light
description: As a basic action, you activate this state and emit bright light in a 12-space radius and dim light for an additional 12 spaces. When you use a power that deals light, spiritual, or fire damage, you gain +2 to attack rolls with and the potency of that power.

name: Plan Your Next Move
description: As a quick action, you may add your Intelligence to your Evasion for one round. You cannot be wearing armor or wielding a shield or weapon with a Strength requirement.

name: Plan Your Next Move II
description: As a free action, you may add your Intelligence to your Evasion for one round. You cannot be wearing armor or wielding a shield or weapon with a Strength requirement.

name: Playing it Safe
description: When you make a skill roll, you may choose to treat any result as no worse than one failure and no better than one success, even if it the result would be. You must choose to do this before making the roll.

name: Pocket Sand
description: Once per turn, when you attack with a finesse weapon or unarmed prowess in melee range, you may reduce the damage of that attack by 2d6 (to a minimum of 0) to cause the target of the attack to make a Fortitude roll against your Martial Potency, becoming Blind on a failure for one minute.

name: Point Blank Shot
description: Ignore the penalties of attacking targets in your Melee Range with ranged attacks.

name: Point Blank Shot II
description: Increase attack rolls and damage by +2 when attacking targets in your Melee Range with ranged attacks. Ignore the penalties of attacking targets in your Melee Range with ranged attacks.

name: Poisoned Strike
description: When you make a martial attack or use a technique that causes the enemy to become Weakened, you may also cause the enemy to take 1d6 poison damage.

name: Poisoner
description: You may apply a consumable to a weapon without an action once each turn.

name: Poisoning Attack
description: Once per turn, when you attack with a non-bludgeoning weapon, you may reduce the damage of that attack by 3d6 (to a minimum of 0) to cause the target of the attack to make a Fortitude roll against your Potency, gaining Weakness 2 for two rounds on a failure. If it was a ranged or Finesse weapon, reduce it by 1d6 instead.

name: Potent Aura
description: When you use a power to target creatures within 2 spaces of you, you gain +3 to effect that creature with any roll or potency that is part of that power.

name: Power Mastery
description: You may choose one power that costs no more than 1/8 of your total Energy; you may cast this power as if innate. You may change which power this is during a Partial Recovery.

name: Power Mastery II
description: You may choose two powers that each cost no more than 1/8 of your total Energy; you may cast these powers as if innate. You may change which powers one or both of these are during a Partial Recovery.

name: Power Phase
description: When you use a non-innate power, you may teleport to a space you can see within 6 spaces without using an action.

name: Power Phase II
description: When you use a non-innate power, you may teleport to a space you can see within 12 spaces without using an action.

name: Empowered Techniques II
description: Reduce the Energy cost of Empowered Techniques by 4 to a minimum of 1.

name: Power Resistant
description: When you try to overcome a power's effect using a defense, that defense increases by +1. In addition, any damage you take from powers is reduced by 2.

name: Power Resistant II
description: When you try to overcome a power's effect using a defense, that defense increases by +2. In addition, any damage you take from powers is reduced by 4.

name: Power Thief
description: When you see a creature use a power that targets you, you may use a quick reaction to roll Arcane or other relevant skill against that creature's Resolve. On a success, you learn what each of the power parts of that power are and may temporarily add it to your power list until you take a full recovery. You are considered proficient with each of the power parts during this time.

name: Power Type Focus
description: Choose one category of power part. Decrease the energy cost of every power that uses parts of this category by -2 Energy to a minimum of 1.

name: Power Type Focus II
description: Decrease the energy cost of every power that uses a part from the chosen power category by -4 Energy to a minimum of 1.

name: Powerful Divine Magic
description: When you use a power that deals spiritual or necrotic damage, you may add your power ability to the damage dealt (if any) once each round.

name: Precision to Power
description: When you make an attack with a weapon, you may choose to take a -5 penalty on the attack roll but increase the damage dealt by 10. You must make this choice before rolling to attack.

name: Predatory Focus
description: Increase your Acuity by +1 for each terminal enemy on the battlefield. (Maximum of +3)

name: Predictive Dodging
description: Increase Evasion by +1.

name: Predictive Dodging II
description: Increase Evasion by +2.

name: Predictive Dodging III
description: Increase Evasion by your Acuity.

name: Prepared Strike
description: Decrease the critical range of your attacks against a target by 1 for each round the target has remained in the same location, to a maximum decrease of 3.

name: Preserve Life
description: As a basic action, you may Heal an amount equal to your level multiplied by four divded how you choose among terminal creatures within 6 spaces of you, including yourself.

name: Primal Power
description: When you make a melee power attack roll, you may add your Strength ability to the attack roll.
req_desc: A power ability that is not strength.

name: Primal Shift
description: As a quick action, you may assume the form of an animal or beast that you have encountered before, as long as its level is no more than 1/2 and it cannot fly. When you do so, you overheal for an amount equal to 1/2 your level, temporarily gain the feats and skills of the animal (taking the higher of any duplicates), and replace your physical abilities/defenses, Acuity/Discernment, movement speed, and Evasion with the creature's. You can choose to drop or cause to shift with you all items on your person when you shift. You may choose to keep a weapon your animal form could wield without difficulty. You cannot use powers while in this form and can only use techniques that make sense for your form's structure. While in this form, you maintain your mind and personality and ability to communicate. The form persists for a number of hours equal to 1/4th your level or until you choose to end it.

name: Primal Shift II
description: As a quick action, you may assume the form of an animal or beast that you have encountered before, as long as its level is no more than 3/4 and it cannot fly. When you do so, you overheal for an amount equal to your level, temporarily gain the feats and skills of the animal (taking the higher of any duplicates), and replace your physical abilities/defenses, Acuity/Discernment, movement speed, and Evasion with the creature's. You can choose to drop or cause to shift with you all items on your person when you shift. You may choose to keep a weapon your animal form could wield without difficulty. The form persists for a number of hours equal to 1/4th your level or until you choose to end it.

description: As a quick action, you may assume the form of an animal or beast that you have encountered before, as long as its level is no more than 1. name: Primal Shift V
description: As a quick action, you may assume the form of an animal or beast that you have encountered before, as long as its level is no more than 3. When you do so, you overheal for an amount equal to your twice your level, temporarily gain the feats and skills of the animal (taking the higher of any duplicates), and replace your physical abilities/defenses, Acuity/Discernment, movement speed, and Evasion with the creature's. name: Primal Shift VI
description: As a quick action, you may assume the form of an animal or beast that you have encountered before, as long as its level is no more than 3. When you do so, you overheal for an amount equal to three times your level, temporarily gain the feats and skills of the animal (taking the higher of any duplicates), and replace your physical abilities/defenses, Acuity/Discernment, movement speed, and Evasion with the creature's. You can choose to drop or cause to shift with you all items on your person when you shift. You may choose to keep a weapon your animal form could wield without difficulty. You can only use powers that have healing effects or area-of-effect damage effects and cost no more than 1/4th of your energy to use. While in this form and can only use techniques that make sense for your form's structure. While in this form, you maintain your mind and personality and ability to communicate. The form persists for a number of hours equal to 1/4th your level or until you choose to end it.
