name: Primal Shift VIII
description: As a quick action, you may assume the form of an animal or beast that you have encountered before, as long as its level is no more than 4. When you do so, you overheal for an amount equal to three times your level, temporarily gain the feats and skills of the animal (taking the higher of any duplicates), and replace your physical abilities/defenses, Acuity/Discernment, movement speed, and Evasion with the creature's. You can choose to drop or cause to shift with you all items on your person when you shift. You may choose to keep a weapon your animal form could wield without difficulty. While in this form and can only use techniques that make sense for your form's structure. While in this form, you maintain your mind and personality and ability to communicate. The form persists for a number of hours equal to 1/4th your level or until you choose to end it. You regain a use of primal shift whenever you roll initative.

name: Primal Warrior
description: When you use defensive power(s), you may deal 1d4 Acid, Lightning, Fire, or Ice damage to any creature that is effected by that defense (attacks it, is blocked by it, etc). The power(s) cannot already be designed to harm creatures in any way.

name: Protective Aura
description: Other creatures within 2 spaces of you get a bonus to all defenses equal to 1/2 of your Charisma.

name: Protective Aura II
description: Other creatures within 2 spaces of you get a bonus to all defenses equal to your Charisma. You get a bonus equal to your defenses equal to half of your Charisma.

name: Protective Aura III
description: You and creatures within 2 spaces of you get a bonus to all defenses equal to your Charisma and cannot be frightened. If a frightened ally enters this range, they lose the frightened condition.

name: Protective Aura IV
description: You and creatures within 6 spaces of you get a bonus to all defenses equal to your Charisma and cannot be frightened or charmed. If a frightened or charmed ally enters this range, they lose the condition(s).

name: Protective Summon
description: When you summon a companion you may choose to teleport up to 6 spaces and place the summon in the space you left. The creature must be summoned into the space you occupied before using this feat.

name: Psionic Connection
description: As a quick action, you may roll 1d6 and choose a number of creatures equal to the roll that you can see. Each creature chosen can communicate telepathically with you, and you with them, for the next hour as long as you remain within two kilometers of eachother and the creature is willing.

name: Psychic Blade
description: As a quick action, you may create a one-handed, finesse, thrown weapon (range 6) in an open hand that deals 1d6 psychic damage and lasts for one minute. You are considered proficient with this weapon. Immidiately after the weapon is used in a thrown attack it returns to your hand. When you deal damage to a creature with this weapon, that creature must make a Mental Fortitude roll. On a failure, they gain Exposed 1 for two rounds.

name: Psychic Blade II
description: As a quick action, you may create one or two one-handed, finesse, thrown weapon(s) (range 6) in open hand(s) that deal 1d8 psychic damage and last for one minute. If you choose to make two, they each deal only 1d4 psychic damage instead and have the interchangable property. Immidiately after the weapon is used in a thrown attack it returns to your hand. When you deal damage to a creature with this weapon, that creature must make a Mental Fortitude roll. On a failure, they gain Exposed 2 for two rounds. You are considered proficient with these weapons.

name: Psychic Link Empowerment
description: Once per turn, when one of your Companions hits a creature that is being affected by one of your powers or a condition you afflicted with an attack, the Companion can deal extra psychic damage equal to your level plus your archetype ability.

name: Psychic Retaliation
description: When you take damage from an attack, you may use a quick reaction to cause the attacker to roll Mental Fortitude against your Potency and take half of the damage you took from the attack on a failure.

name: Psychic Retaliation II
description: When you take damage from an attack, you may use a free reaction to cause the attacker to roll Mental Fortitude against your Potency and take half of the damage you took from the attack on a failure.

name: Psychic Retaliation III
description: When you take damage from an attack, you may cause the attacker to roll Mental Fortitude against your Potency and take half of the damage you took from the attack plus your Archetype Bonus on a failure.

name: Psychic Shift
description: When you use a power that deals damage, you may choose to change that damage type to psychic instead before rolling to attack, targeting Mental Fortitude instead.

name: Psychic Strikes
description: Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a martial attack, you may deal an additional 1d4 psychic damage as well.

name: Pulling Force State
description: When a creature within 6 spaces of you starts its turn, you may choose to spend a quick reaction to roll a Martial or Power attack against its Might, causing it to teleport within 1 space of you on a success.

name: Quick Draw
description: Sheathing or drawing weapons or shields does not require an interaction, unless you've already interacted with an item that turn in one of these ways.

name: Quick Estimate
description: When appraising items during an encounter you may choose to gain -5 to the roll, but treat any Success as two Successes higher.

name: Quick Phase
description: As a quick action, you teleport 6 spaces to a location that you can see.

name: Quick Recovery
description: Reduce the time you require to recover by 25%.

name: Quick Stealth
description: When you take the Stealth or Hide action, you may do so as a quick action instead. If you are detected during your turn, you may take this action during that turn using a free action instead.

name: Quickened State
description: When you enter this state, you can take the movement action as a free action, and while in this state, you can gain +3 Movement Speed.

name: Quickening Rush
description: When you use a feat, power, or technique that heals or buffs any number of allied creatures, you may choose to allow them to immediately move up to half of their movement speed for free.

name: Quivering Palm
description: When you hit a target with unarmed prowess, you may cause them to roll Fortitude against your Potency, causing them to gain the dying condition or take 10d10 necrotic damage on a success. This roll can be made immediately or any time in the future when you choose to have this effect activate. You can only have one creature affected this way at a time.

name: Radiance of Day
description: As a basic action, roll a power attack targeting Fortitude for each creature of your choice within 6 spaces. On a success, targets take 1d10 Light or Spiritual damage, and on a failure, they take half. Any magical darkness within 6 spaces is dispelled.

name: Radiance of Day II
description: As a basic action, roll a power attack targeting Fortitude for each creature of your choice within 6 spaces. On a success, targets take 2d10 Light or Spiritual damage, and on a failure, they take half. Any magical darkness within 6 spaces is dispelled.

name: Radiant Sear
description: Whenever a creature enters or starts its turn within 2 spaces of you, it takes light, holy, spiritual, or necrotic damage equal to your Power Attack Bonus.

name: Rage
description: As a quick action, you can enter this state. While in this state, you add +2 to your damage when attacking with Strength (you can take this feat multiple times, increasing by an additional +1 for each level taken). The state ends if you do not attack for a round or if you enter the dying condition. To use this feat you cannot be focusing on or sustaining any powers.

name: Ranged Aficionado
description: When attacking with a ranged weapon, you may spend one additional Action Point to add 3 spaces of range to your attack.

name: Ranged Defense
description: When holding a weapon with the "Block" property, you can treat physical ranged attack rolls as the same as melee attacks for blocking.
req_desc: Block Item proficiency

name: Ranged Monk
description: When making a ranged attack with a monk weapon, you may spend an extra Action Point to add 1dX damage, where X is equal to your Martial Bonus.
req_desc: Monk Weaponry Feat
tags: Ranged Attack,Monk Weapon,Action Point Cost,Damage Increase

name: Ranger
description: Choose one type of Environment. When traversing this environment, you have +2 to all checks related to it, such as Navigate, Track, Nature, and so on.

name: Rapid Cast
description: When you use a power, you may decrease its time to cast by 1 action point to a minimum of a free action.

name: Rapid Recovery
description: At the start of your turn, you heal 5 Health.

name: Rapid Recovery II
description: At the start of your turn in combat encounters, you heal 10 Health.

name: Re-vitalizing Recovery
description: When you recover, you may choose to gain 3 Health for each 2 hour spent recovering.

name: Re-vitalizing Recovery II
description: When you recover, you may choose to gain 6 Health for each 2 hour spent recovering.

name: Re-vitalizing Recovery III
description: When you recover, you may choose to gain 9 Health for each 2 hour spent recovering.

name: Ready for Action
description: When you enter combat, you gain two turns for the first round of that combat, one when you would normally go and one as if you had rolled -10 less for initiative.

name: Ready to Run
description: After taking the Move action, you may move an extra 1/2 of your Movement Speed. This can occur only once each round.

name: Ready, Aim...
description: Increase your Acuity by +1 against a chosen target for every round it remains stationary, to a maximum bonus of +3. Persists until they move.

name: Reaper's Vitality
description: Increase your Vitality by +1 for each terminal enemy on the battlefield. (Maximum of +3)

name: Reckless Abandon
description: As a free action, you may choose to decrease your Evasion by 3 but reduce any damage you take the first time in a turn by your Fortitude bonus. This lasts for one round.

name: Reckless Attack
description: As a free reaction to missing an attack, you may increase your attack roll by up to +5, potentially causing it to hit instead. Attacks that target you for the next round gain an equal increase.

name: Recoil
description: The first time you are attacked each round, you may roll 1d8. On an 8, you may use a free basic action as a reaction.

name: Redirect
description: When a melee attack misses you, you may use a 2 Action Point unarmed prowess reaction to cause that attack to hit a target within your melee range.

name: Reflexive Action
description: If you did not take the basic or quick action on your turn, you gain an additional action point at the end of your turn that can only be used to take reactions.
req_desc: Acuity or Agility of at least 2

name: Refreshing Transposition
description: When you teleport, you may choose a creature within 2 spaces of where you teleported from and overheal that creature 1d10. This effect does not occur outside of combat.

name: Rejuvenating Healing
description: When you heal a target using a power, you may allow them to gain +2 to their next defense against an attack or defense roll.

name: Relentless State
description: Your state features no longer end when you don't attack or enter the dying condition.

name: Relentless Vitality
description: When you would drop to 0 or fewer Health while in this state, you can instead roll Fortitude DS 10, and on a success, instead set your Health equal to 2x your Fortitude bonus. Each time you use this feat, the DS increases by 5 until you take a full or partial recovery.

name: Reliable Insiration
description: When a creature uses an inspiration die you've given to them via the Inspire feat and still fails their related roll, the inspiration die is not used up.
req_desc: The Inspire feat

name: Reliable Skill
description: Choose a skill. Before rolling that skill, you may treat that roll as if it were a 10. Can be taken multiple times, but the level requirement increases by 2 each time.
req_desc: At least 3 skill points in chosen skill.

name: Reliant Powers
description: You may choose three powers that each cost no more than 1/4 of your total Energy. You may cast each of these powers once without Energy cost every Full Recovery.

name: Renewing State
description: When you enter this state, you can choose to regain a number of state uses equal to 1/2 your Martial + Power bonus.

name: Repairing Sphere
description: All broken items within 6 spaces of you instantly become restored to their most well-kept and effective state unless a supernatural power is keeping those objects in that state.

name: Repelling Blast
description: Choose an innate power that targets Evasion. When you deal damage with this power against a creature that is Large or smaller, you may cause it to be pushed back 1 space.

name: Reserved Power
description: When using a power that targets one creature and the attack misses, you recover 1/4 of the Energy spent.

name: Reserves of Health
description: You may spend a quick action to heal 1d12.

name: Resilience
description: While in Terminal, reduce all damage taken by half of your Vitality, rounded up.

name: Resilience II
description: While in Terminal, reduce all damage taken by an amount equal to your Vitality.

name: Resolved Mind
description: You have +2 to defenses when resisting effects attempting to charm or frighten you.

name: Responsive to Remedy
description: When you consume something that would heal you or grant a positive effect, you also heal 1 Health. Increase this by 1 additional Health per level of this feat.

name: Retaliate
description: When you take damage from a target's attack within 1 space of you, you may make a weapon or unarmed prowess attack as a basic reaction. You may only use this feat once per round.

name: Retaliation
description: When you take damage from a critical hit you gain 1 Action Point.

name: Retroactive Protection
description: As a quick reaction to a creature within 12 spaces that you can see or hear taking damage, you may overheal that creature for 2d6.

name: Reverberate
description: When you block a critical hit with a shield or weapon with the Block property, the attacker takes damage equal to your double martial attack bonus.

name: Revivification
description: When a creature within 12 spaces would fall to or below 0 Health, you may use a quick reaction to cause them to drop to 1 Health instead.

name: Risky Play
description: When you make a Charisma skill roll, you may choose to treat any success as one degree higher and any failure as one degree lower before you make the roll.

name: Sacred Weapon
description: Choose a weapon upon activating this state. When you deal damage with this weapon, it may deal spiritual damage instead of its damage type. It emits bright light for 4 spaces and dim light for 4 more spaces. When you deal damage with this weapon, you may add your Charisma to the damage dealt once per turn.

name: Sanctuary
description: As a basic action, you may cause a 2-space radius sphere to appear within 24 spaces. Each ally within that area is considered to be moderately obscured. As a basic action, you can move this sphere 3 spaces. This persists until you choose to end it or you enter the dying condition.

name: Sanctuary II
description: As a basic action, you may cause a 2-space radius sphere to appear within 24 spaces. Each ally within that area is considered to be moderately obscured. As a quick action, you can move this sphere 6 spaces. This persists until you choose to end it or you enter the dying condition. In addition, each ally of your choice in the area gains resistance to an elemental damage type of your choice between fire, ice, lightning, poison, and acid.

name: Saw this Coming
description: You may add your Acuity to any Initiative roll you make.

name: Scholar
description: When you fail an Intelligence-based skill check to recall information or learn a fact, you know where to find the knowledge or how to find an expert in the relevant field.

name: Seamless Strikes
description: When you spend a use of a non-state feat that requires a quick or basic action to use, you may make an unarmed prowess attack as part of that same action.

name: Sedative Strike
description: When you make an attack against a target, you may add +1 to that attack's damage for each round you've remained in the same location, to a maximum increase of +3.

name: Seeing an Opening
description: After hitting an attack, you may roll Analyze against the target's Resolve. On a success, each time the target attacks you, you may use a basic reaction to make an attack against that creature. You may only have one creature affected this way at a time.

name: Seeker
description: You can take the Search or Detect action without any action cost once each round.

name: Seeking Power
description: When you target Evasion with a power and miss, you may re-roll the d20 to attack and use the new roll.

name: Self-Sustaining
description: As a basic action, you may overheal 1d4 Health plus 1/2 your power ability. This ability may only be used outside of an encounter.

name: Self-Sustaining II
description: As a basic action, you may overheal 1d8 Health plus your power ability.

name: Semi-Echolocation
description: When you succeed on a perceive roll relying on hearing, you gain more details about the detected thing's appearance, such as creature size and type if discernible by body structure.

name: Sentinel
description: Once per combat, you may take a basic action spending only 1 Action Point (costing only 1 AP instead of 2). Doing so requires that you haven't moved on your turn. You cannot take the movement action for the rest of the round after using this feat.

name: Shadow Step
description: When obscured by shadow, you may use a quick action to move from your current location to a shadow-obscured location you can see within 12 spaces.

name: Shadow Step
description: When obscured by shadow, you may use a quick action to move from your current location to a shadow-obscured location you can see within 12 spaces.

name: Shapeshift
description: You may spend a minute to change your voice, coloration, hair length, and sex. You can also adjust your height, weight, and race. Changing your race doesn't affect any of your features; it is cosmetic only. You stay in this form until you choose to revert, or you die.

name: Shared Overheal
description: As a quick reaction to a creature within 6 spaces taking damage while you have Health that exceed your maximum health, you may expend those Health equal to the amount of damage you wish to reduce from the damage that creature took.

name: Shared Power
description: When you use a power that targets only yourself, you may treat it as targeting a summon or familiar within 6 spaces as well.

name: Sharp Mind
description: When you make an Intelligence skill roll, you can add your Acuity to the roll as well.

name: Sharpshooter
description: When attacking with a ranged weapon and targeting a creature at least 10 spaces away, you increase the damage dealt by 1d2.

name: Shifting
description: As a quick action, you may take the physical form of a creature your size or one size smaller that you have seen and has the same arrangement and number of limbs. This form looks exactly like that creature, including having all objects worn or carried by you shifting to match that form. Your voice doesn't become altered in the form to match.

name: Shifting Dodge
description: You may take the dodge reaction as a free reaction once each round.

name: Shrouded
description: When you are obscured by darkness, you count as one level more obscured. If you are completely obscured, you are treated as if you have the Invisible condition.

name: Signature Power
description: You may choose one power that costs no more than 1/16 of your total Energy; you may cast this power as if innate. You may change which power this is during a Partial Recovery.

name: Signature Power II
description: You may choose one power that costs no more than 1/8 of your total Energy; you may cast this power as if innate. You may change which power this is during a Partial Recovery.

name: Signature Power III
description: You may choose two powers that each cost no more than 1/8 of your total Energy; you may cast these powers as if innate. You may change which powers one or both of these are during a Partial Recovery.

name: Silver-Tongued Negotiator
description: With your persuasive charm, you excel in negotiation and bargaining situations. Gain a +2 bonus to Persuade skill rolls when haggling prices or making deals.

name: Sizing Up
description: After engaging in a conversation with a creature for at least 1 minute, you can make an Analyze roll even if you don't have the skill. Add your Charisma to this roll in addition to Acuity.

name: Slay Summoning
description: Summon 1 level 1/4 summon for free when you get a finishing blow.

name: Slay Summoning II
description: Summon 1 level 1/2 summon for free when you get a finishing blow.

name: Slay Summoning III
description: Summon 1 level 1 summon for free when you get a finishing blow.

name: Slay Summoning IV (opt 1)
description: Summon 1 level 2 summon when you get a finishing blow.

name: Slay Summoning IV (opt 2)
description: Summon 1 level 1 summon for free when you get a finishing blow.

name: Slow Fall
description: As a quick reaction to taking fall damage, you can reduce the damage taken by 10.

name: Slow Fall II
description: As a free reaction to taking fall damage, you can reduce the damage taken by 15.

name: Slow Fall III
description: As a free reaction to taking fall damage, you can reduce the damage taken by 35.

name: Small Defenses
description: When attacked by an enemy of a larger size than you, they decrease their attack roll by 1.
req_desc: Small size or smaller

name: Smite of Protection
description: When you use a technique that successfully deals damage, you and each creature of your choice within 2 spaces are considered moderately obscured, or obscurity increases by 2 if already obscured, for one round as long as they remain within 2 spaces.

name: Soldier's Dive
description: You can choose to gain resistance to all damage types for 2 rounds.

name: Speak with the Dead
description: As a basic action, you may touch a corpse and cause it to answer up to five questions as it might have answered in life. The answers may be cryptic or repetitive. Once five questions have been asked, or after 10 minutes, the corpse returns to its inanimate state.

name: Spectral Wings
description: When you take the Move action, you may spend 1 Action Point in addition to gain a flying speed equal to your movement speed until the end of your turn.

name: Speed Climbing
description: Increase your climbing speed by 1/2 your Agility.
req_desc: At least 1 Strength or 1 Vitality.

name: Spell Manipulation
description: Remove or reduce 1 power part from a power upon performing it. Don't pay the Energy cost for said part. (Does not permanently remove power parts, just upon performing.)

name: Spell Manipulation II
description: Remove or reduce up to 2 power parts from a power upon performing it. Don't pay the Energy cost for said parts. (Does not permanently remove power parts, just upon performing.)

name: Spiked Armor
description: You gain access to the "Spiked" armor property, which allows you to deal 1d4 damage plus your martial attack bonus each time you achieve a Critical hit. Adding this property to armor costs 30 gold and has a 4 TP cost (which you already have proficiency with).

name: Spiked Mind
description: When a creature deals psychic damage to you, that creature takes half of that damage as psychic damage themselves.

name: Spiked Mind II
description: When a creature deals psychic damage to you, that creature takes the same amount of damage as psychic damage themselves.

name: Spiritual Force
description: When you make a martial attack, you may choose to change the damage dealt to spiritual damage instead.

name: Spiritual Force II
description: When you make a martial attack, you may choose to change the damage dealt to spiritual or light damage instead. Additionally, once per round, you may make this damage deal an additional 1d8 spiritual damage.

name: Spiritual Force III
description: When you make a martial attack, you may choose to change the damage dealt to spiritual or light damage instead. Additionally, once per round, you may make this damage deal an additional 2d8 spiritual damage.

name: Spiritual Shield
description: When an ally within 6 spaces of you that you can see takes damage, you may use a quick reaction to reduce that damage by 1d6. You may level this feat, increasing the die size by 1d2. At levels 3 and 4, you gain 1 extra use of this feat. The level requirement increases by 4 per level of this feat.

name: Splitting Power
description: You may choose two powers that cost no less than 50 Energy and target only one creature. When you use either, you can choose a second target within 2 spaces of the first to be affected by the power as well.

name: Sprinter
description: Add 1/4 STR to MS.

name: Staggering Blow
description: When you deal damage equal to or more than the maximum damage that attack could normally deal, you may choose to cause the target to have -5 on the next defense that it has targeted in the next round.

name: Staggering Strikes
description: When you achieve a critical hit with a weapon with the Staggered property, increase the applied Staggered Condition level by 2.

name: Starting on the Right Foot
description: When combat starts, you gain +4 Movement Speed for two rounds.

name: State of Defense
description: You may use a quick reaction to reduce damage dealt to you by any source by up to 1/4 of your total Energy. Spend 1 Energy for each 2 damage reduced this way.

name: State of the Eagle
description: You have a flying speed equal to 1/2 of your movement speed.

name: State of the Eagle II
description: You have a flying speed equal to your movement speed.

name: State of the Lion
description: Enemies within 1 space of you have -3 to attack creatures other than you.

name: State of the Ram
description: When you deal damage to a target with a weapon, you may choose to have them roll a Reflex or Might against your Attack Score or become knocked prone. This effect can only happen once a turn.

name: State of the Wolf
description: While you are within 1 space of an enemy, your allies gain +1 to attack rolls against that enemy.

name: Steady Aim
description: As a quick action, you may gain +2 on your next martial attack roll, provided you haven't moved this turn.

name: Steady Aim
description: As a quick action, you may gain +2 on your next martial attack roll, provided you haven't moved this turn. Your speed becomes 0 after using this action.

name: Steadying Focus
description: You may add your Acuity to your Fortitude defense.

name: Still Mind
description: Increase your Intelligence by +1 in combat for every 2 rounds you've remained stationary, to a maximum increase of +2. Persists until you move.

name: Stipulation
description: Choose a feat you have. While you meet the criteria of a stipulation, you may treat that feat as one level higher (if any) than it is currently. Alternatively, you may choose a feat to add to your feat list which you do not have which persists until you no longer meet the criteria of your stipulation. Stipulations could be: Must be holding a specific item other than a weapon/shield, underwater, in the air, held by an ally, holding an ally, below half health, above full health, and so on. The feat that you choose must not be one which would primarily be used when that stipulation is met, such as a feat that allows flight having a stipulation of needing to be in the air. Approve the stipulation with your Realms Master. It should be used as a role-playing hook, character quirk, etc.

name: Strategic Weaponry
description: When you make an attack roll with a weapon that has properties which apply effects, you may choose to take -2 to your attack roll and increase one of those effects by one. Do this for each -2 you take.

name: Strike of Force
description: When you make an attack with unarmed prowess, you may choose to affect all targets in a line of spaces equal to your Martial Bonus, using one roll to hit and damage.

name: Strike of Truth
description: After hitting a creature with an attack, they must roll Resolve against your Power or Technique Potency. On a failure, they become incapable of telling a lie for 10 minutes.

name: Studied Attacks
description: When you make an attack roll against a creature's Evasion and miss, you gain Advantage on your next attack against that creature before the end of your next turn or for one round, whichever is longer.

name: Stunning Strike
description: Once per turn, when you attack with a finesse weapon, you may reduce the damage of that attack by 2d6 (to a minimum of 0) to cause the target of the attack to make a Fortitude roll against your Attack Score, gaining Stun 2 on a failure.
req_desc: Proficiency with Finesse property

name: Stunning Strike II
description: Once per turn, when you attack with a finesse weapon, you may reduce the damage of that attack by 5d6 (to a minimum of 0) to cause the target of the attack to make a Fortitude roll against your Attack Score, gaining Stun 5 on a failure. You may choose between this and the 1st level of this fear's effect to use.
req_desc: Proficiency with Finesse property

name: Stylized Armor
description: You gain access to the following armor properties: "Stylize: Intimidate," "Stylize: Charm," "Stylize: Taunt," and "Stylize: Persuade" and may choose one of them to gain Proficiency in; the others must be gained by spending Training Points as normal. These armor parts give you +2 to their respective skills.

name: Subdue the Weak
description: Once per turn, when you hit a creature that has less than full Health with a martial attack, you may deal 1d2 additional damage of the weapon’s type.

name: Subtle Truth
description: When you fail an Intelligence skill roll to gain or recall information, you know if some of the information you gain is false such as occurs when you fail some skill rolls.

name: Summon Familiar
description: As a basic action, you may summon a 1/4th-level animal with no Energy cost that is loyal to you. Its form is spiritual only and persists until you take a Full Recovery. You must use the use of another feat that has at most 2 uses that it regains on a Partial or Full Recovery (at its base level) to use this feat.
req_desc: A feat with at most 2 uses that renew on Partial or Full Recovery (at its base level)

name: Summoning Specialty
description: When you summon a creature using a power, you may add points to the Health or Energy maximum(s) of that creature equal to 1/2 your level. You should choose how much to increase each pool, dividing your level of points between them.

name: Sundering Blow
description: When you deal damage equal to or more than the maximum damage that attack could normally deal, you may choose to cause the next attack roll against this target by another creature to have +5.

name: Super Skillz
description: Increase the skill cap of one skill by 2 or two skills by 1. You can take this feat more than once.
req_desc: At least 2 points in chosen skills, or a 3 if one skill is chosen.

name: Superior Experienced Defense
description: As a basic reaction to being hit by an attack, you may gain resistance to that attack’s damage for one turn.

name: Superior Experienced Defense II
description: As a quick reaction to being hit by an attack, you may gain resistance to that attack’s damage for one turn.

name: Superiority
description: When you use a technique that has an attack roll or potency, you may add 1d6 to the roll or score. You may level this feat, increasing the die by 1d2 up to a maximum of 1d12. The level requirement for this feat increases by 4 for each level of the feat. At the 3rd and 4th levels of this feat, you gain 1 extra use.

name: Supernatural Wings
description: As a quick action, you gain a flying speed of 12. This effect persists for 1 hour or until you decide to end it.

name: Supreme Healing
description: When you would roll dice to heal with a power, you may treat half the dice as healing their maximum possible number instead and roll the rest as normal.

name: Supreme Healing II
description: When you would roll dice to heal with a power, you may treat all dice as healing their maximum possible number instead.

name: Sure Innate Powers
description: When you would not overcome a defense or miss with an innate power that deals damage, you may still deal half of the damage you would have dealt.

name: Surprising Strike
description: When you make a martial attack against a target that hasn't had a turn in combat yet, you may add one extra die of the weapon's type to the damage.

name: Surrounded
description: Gain 1 Action Point for every 2 enemies in your Melee Range at the end of your turn.

name: Susceptibility Insight
description: You may roll Insight against the Resolve of a creature, gaining a bonus to any Charm roll against that creature within the next 10 minutes equal to the degree of success of your Insight roll.

name: Swift Powers
description: When you use a power, it takes 1 action point less than it does regularly.

name: Swimmer
description: You can swim a number of spaces equal to 1/2 your movement speed when you take the move action. It costs 2 spaces of movement per space moved while swimming

name: Tactical Expert
description: When you achieve a critical hit with a weapon attack, you may choose to apply a Condition (level 2, if any) from any weapon property you are proficient with, even if the weapon does not have it.
req_desc: Proficiency with at least 3 weapon properties

name: Tandem Initiation
description: When you roll initiative, you may add a number equal to your Charisma to the initiative roll of an ally who can see or hear you within 12 spaces.

name: Tap for Tap
description: If an attack hits you exactly on your Evasion (EV), you may immediately use a basic action attack as a quick reaction to attack that creature.

name: Taunting Jaunt
description: When you teleport, each creature within 1 space of where you teleport must roll Resolve against your Potency or gain -3 for 1 round to attack creatures other than you. This effect does not occur outside of combat.

name: Team Repositioning
description: When an enemy moves within 1 space of you, you may spend a use of another feat or 3 energy and use a free reaction to move up to your movement speed. An ally of your choice within 6 spaces who can see or hear you can do the same.

name: Telekinesis
description: As a basic action, choose one loose object that is Large or smaller or one willing creature other than you. You transport the target up to 6 spaces to an unoccupied space you can see. If the target is Tiny, you can transport it to or from your hand.

name: Telling Eye
description: Your Resolve and Insight increase by +2 when being misled or lied to.

name: The Beast
description: As a free action, you may flip a coin. On heads, you stay normal; on tails, the RM controls you for 1 round. All stats get +2 and can exceed the cap by 1.

name: The Holmes Effect
description: You can take an Intelligence Skill action as a free action once each round.

name: Thieves' Best Friend
description: When using the Tailor skill you may incorporate various hidden pockets into a piece of clothing, allowing the wearer to easily smuggle small objects. Objects slipped into or out of these pockets grant a +1 to Sleight of Hand Skill rolls per degree of success of crafted clothing.

name: Thick Skin
description: When you are hit by a critical hit, reduce damage taken by 1/2 of your Vitality.

name: Think Fast
description: While in Terminal, increase your Intelligence by +1/4.

name: Think Fast II
description: While in Terminal, increase your Intelligence by +1/2.

name: Think Fast III
description: While in Terminal, double your Intelligence.

name: Third Eye
description: At the end of each full recovery choose one form of vision sight/sense other than blindsense. Gain that vision type to a range of 6 spaces until your next full recovery.

name: Timeless
description: You can no longer age or die of natural causes.

name: Tinkerer
description: You can create tiny working devices or automatons using 10 minutes of time and with a successful DS 12 Tinker roll. These can perform basic functions such as those specified in the Interact action. They can only perform the same task repetitively or begin performing a task for a set amount of time based on some realistic trigger, such as a timer, windup, or button.

name: Tireless
description: Once per Full Recovery when you finish a Partial Recovery, you may lose 1 level of exhaustion.

name: Tireless Warrior
description: The first time you gain the Exhaustion condition each partial recovery, you instead take levels of Weakened equal to triple the amount of exhaustion you would've gained.

name: To the Shadow Realm
description: When you hit a creature with an attack roll against Evasion, you may cause that creature to roll Resolve against your Potency. On a failure, they disappear from this realm momentarily. The target takes 4d10 psychic damage and reappears at the beginning of their next turn with 2 fewer Action Points.

name: To the Shadow Realm II
description: When you hit a creature with an attack roll against Evasion, you may cause that creature to roll Resolve against your Potency. On a failure, they disappear from this realm momentarily. The target takes 8d10 psychic damage and reappears at the beginning of their next turn with 3 fewer Action Points.

name: Touch of Death
description: When you reduce a creature to 0 Health with an attack, you may spend an Action Point to regain Health equal to your attack roll bonus (Attacking Ability + Martial Bonus).

name: Towering Physique
description: You count as one size larger when grappling.

name: Trance
description: As a free action outside of combat you may gain blindsense in a radius of 2 spaces for a number of rounds equal to the points you have invested in the Perceive skill.

name: Trance of Balance
description: Any attack against you loses all outside bonuses. Any time you roll a d20 and get below 10, you may choose to treat the roll as having gotten 10 instead. Outside bonuses could be bonuses from feats, powers, techniques, or other environmental factors that are not an archetype attack bonus or skill bonuses.

name: Tranquility
description: After completing a Full Recovery, you cannot be attacked unless a target first overcomes your Resolve with a Charisma ability roll. This effect persists until you attack or are hit with an attack but persists no longer than 24 hours.

name: Transformed Maw
description: You may use a quick action to morph jaws for one minute. Jaws are a 1d4 piercing damage weapon that uses Strength for attack and damage rolls. They count as unarmed prowess. Once per round, when you deal damage with your jaws, you heal an amount equal to your martial bonus.

name: Transmutation
description: When you use a power that deals elemental damage, you may change its damage type to a different element.

name: Transport State
description: As a quick action, you may teleport to a location that you can see within 6 spaces of your current location. You may only do this once in a turn.

name: Transport State II
description: As a quick action, you may teleport to a location that you can see within 12 spaces of your current location. You may only do this once in a turn. Once per state, you may increase this range to 36 and transport up to 6 willing creatures with you within 2 spaces of the target location.

name: Triage
description: Increase your healing done to terminal creatures by +1/4.

name: Triage II
description: Increase your healing done to terminal creatures by +1/2.

name: Tripping Attack
description: Once per turn, when you attack with a finesse weapon, you may reduce the damage of that attack by 1d6 (to a minimum of 0) to cause the target of the attack to make a Might or Reflex roll against your Attack Score, falling Prone upon a failure.
req_desc: Proficiency with Finesse property or unarmed prowess.

name: Trying New Things
description: Double your Training Points and Training Point maximum. You may choose how many of your total Training Points you wish to double this way; these Training Points may only be used on technique parts. Each time you level, you can increase this pool of doubled Training Points or choose to use them as singular Training Points for alternative uses.

name: Turn
description: Choose one creature type other than humanoid. As a basic action, make a power attack against each creature of that creature type within 12 spaces, targeting Resolve. On a success, the creature(s) become frightened of you and take the Move action at least once each turn to move away from you if they can. This ends once the frightened condition ends, and the frightened condition ends if the creature takes damage or if you enter the dying condition.

name: Turn II
description: As a basic action, make a power attack against each creature of that creature type within 12 spaces, targeting Resolve. On a success, the creature(s) take a number of d8s equal to your Power Ability in Light, Dark, Spiritual, or Necrotic damage and become frightened of you and take the Move action at least once each turn to move away from you if they can. This ends once the frightened condition ends, and the frightened condition ends if the creature takes damage or if you enter the dying condition.

name: Twinned Power
description: When you use a power with an energy cost less than or equal to 20 that targets only one creature, you may instead cause it to target one additional creature within range.

name: Two-Handed Power
description: When making an attack with a two-handed weapon, you may spend 1 Action Point to add your martial bonus again to the attack roll.

name: Unarmed Extension
description: When you attack with unarmed prowess, you do so at a range of 4 spaces, using the same attack roll. The damage type of this attack can be any you choose. This attack deals 1d2 less damage than a regular unarmed attack. You may only use this type of attack once per turn.

name: Unarmored Agility
description: Increase your Movement Speed by +2 when you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield.

name: Unarmored Agility II
description: Increase your Movement Speed by +3 when you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield.

name: Unarmored Agility III
description: Increase your Movement Speed by +4 when you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield.

name: Unarmored Defense (Opt 1)
description: While not wearing armor, reduce all damage taken by 2.

name: Unarmored Defense (Opt 2)
description: While not wearing armor, reduce all damage taken by 3.

name: Unarmored Defense II (Opt 1)
description: While not wearing armor, reduce all damage taken by 3.

name: Unarmored Defense II (Opt 2)
description: While not wearing armor, reduce all damage taken by 5.

name: Unarmored Defense III (Opt 1)
description: While not wearing armor, reduce all damage taken by 4.

name: Unarmored Defense III (Opt 2)
description: While not wearing armor, reduce all damage taken by 7.

name: Unarmored Evasion
description: While not wearing armor or wielding a shield increase your Evasion by +2.

name: Unarmored Evasion II
description: While not wearing armor or wielding a shield increase your Evasion by +3.

name: Unarmored Evasion III
description: While not wearing armor or wielding a shield increase your Evasion by +4.

name: Unbreakable Presence
description: When a creature hits you with an attack the first time on a turn, that creature must roll Resolve against your Power Potency, and on failure, the attack misses instead. This state feature can only activate with your state 1 time per recovery.

name: Unbreakable Soul
description: You gain +1 to all defenses, excluding Evasion and Vigilance.
req_desc: And no more than -1 between all negative abilities.

name: Undeniable Body
description: You may add your Strength or Vitality (choose when obtaining this feat) to Charm Skill rolls; however, you treat failures as one degree lower when doing so.
req_desc: Vitality or Strength of at least 1.

name: Underdog Confidence
description: When an attack by an enemy whose level is higher than yours hits, roll 1d12. On a 12, that attack misses instead.

name: Unerring Strike
description: Once per turn, when you miss an attack against a creature's Evasion, you may treat the attack as if it hit instead.

name: Unfailing Evasion
description: No effect can reduce your Evasion other than self-imposed conditions or effects, and attacks against your Evasion can never have a bonus more than +8 to their roll.

name: Unfailing Luck
description: Whenever you make a skill, attack, or defense roll, you may spend 6 energy as a free action to remove all penalties to that roll. You may do the same as a free reaction to any score targeted as well.

name: Unnatural
description: Increase one ability cap by 1. (Maximum of 6 for basic PC.)

name: Unnatural Tail
description: You may use a quick action to grow a tail for one minute. The tail has the "block" and "reach" properties and is a 1d4 bludgeoning damage weapon that uses Strength for attack and damage rolls. It counts as a weapon you're proficient with.

name: Unpredictable Evasion
description: When you or an ally within 6 spaces is targeted by an attack against Evasion, you may use a quick reaction to increase your or that creature's Evasion by your Charisma against that attack, potentially causing it to miss.

name: Unwavering Might
description: As a quick reaction you may increase your Might by +3 for 4 rounds.

name: Upsell
description: When you attempt to buy or sell objects, you can spend 10 minutes with that object and roll Deception. For each degree of success, you can increase or decrease the apparent value by 5% (DS is usually equal to the target creature's Appraise score).

name: Urgent Care
description: When a creature within 12 spaces that you can see enters the dying condition, you may use a quick reaction to cause that creature to heal Health equal to 1/4 its Health maximum. Each creature within 6 spaces of that creature takes 2d8 spiritual damage and gains the Blind condition until the end of their turn(s).

name: Utility Specialist
description: When you use a non-adaptation, non-summoning power that deals no damage and inflicts no conditions, you may choose to spend only 1/2 of the power's Energy cost.

name: Variety Evasion
description: Once per round as a free reaction you can add +2 to your Evasion against Powers or Techniques targeting it.

name: Veil
description: You may use a quick action to give yourself the Invisible condition until the end of the turn.

name: Viable Stability
description: When one of your defenses is overcome, you may use a quick reaction to re-roll that defense or have the one causing the effect re-roll. The new roll must be used.

name: Vitality Surge
description: When you activate this state, you overheal Health equal to your level.

name: Wall Walk
description: As long as you do not end your turn on a vertical surface, you can move up or down it normally as if it were regular terrain.
req_desc: At least 1 other Agility, Power, or Technique Feat; or at least 3 Agility.

name: War Mount
description: Mounted creatures with this feat have disadvantage on Intimidation checks against them.

name: Ward
description: Choose 2 creature types. Whenever one of your defenses is targeted by a creature of this type, you gain +5 to that defense.

name: Warding
description: As a quick reaction to a creature you can see within 6 spaces attacking another creature, you may decrease their roll to attack by 2.

name: Warlock's Power
description: Your powers cost 5 less energy to use, but you cannot use non-innate powers that cost less than 1/4th of your energy to use (including the 5 energy reduction and any other reductions). The limitation of the maximum energy a power can cost is 30 multiplied by your Power Proficiency instead of 20 energy as normal.

name: Warp
description: As a basic action, you may teleport to a location you can see within 24 spaces. Any creature within 6 spaces of where you were when you used this action must roll Might against your Potency or be pulled to that location and take 2d6 magic damage, taking half damage if they succeed and not be pulled to that location.

name: Water Breathing
description: As a quick action, you gain the ability to breathe underwater for 1 hour.

name: Water Walk
description: As long as you do not end your turn on a liquid surface, you can move across it normally as if it were regular terrain.
req_desc: At least 1 other Agility, Power, or Technique Feat; or at least 3 Agility.

name: Way of the Monk
description: When taking a basic action to attack with unarmed prowess as a technique or as a basic attack, you may make another unarmed attack as part of the same action without applying the multiple attack penalty. Future attacks are treated as having the multiple attack penalty as if you made just one attack.
req_desc: Proficiency with Unarmed Prowess.

name: Way of the Monk II
description: When taking a basic action to attack with unarmed prowess as a technique or as a basic attack, you may make two more unarmed attacks as part of the same action without applying the multiple attack penalty. Future attacks are treated as having the multiple attack penalty as if you made just one unarmed prowess attack.

name: Way of the Monk III
description: When taking a basic action to attack with unarmed prowess as a technique or as a basic attack, you may make three more unarmed attacks as part of the same action without applying the multiple attack penalty. Future attacks are treated as having the multiple attack penalty as if you made just one unarmed prowess attack.

name: Way of the Monk IV
description: When taking a basic action to attack with unarmed prowess as a technique or as a basic attack, you may make four more unarmed attacks as part of the same action without applying the multiple attack penalty. Future attacks are treated as having the multiple attack penalty as if you made just one unarmed prowess attack.

name: Weakened Resolve
description: When you cause a creature to make a Resolve roll that, on failure, causes and effect (using a power, technique, or feat), you may cause that creature to become frightened for the duration of that effect.

name: Weakening Blow
description: After hitting a target with a technique, you may choose to spend 2 Energy to apply Weakened 1. You may choose to increase this for each 2 Energy spent, increasing the level of Weakened to a maximum of Weakened 3.

name: Weapon Bond
description: Choose up to 2 weapons. As a free action, you may cause either of these weapons to come to your hand. While you hold either weapon, you cannot be disarmed unless you enter the dying condition. You can change which weapons you are bonded to every Partial Recovery.

name: Weapon Mastery
description: Decrease the Training Point requirement to acquire proficiency with weapon properties by 1. (You spend one fewer Training Point per weapon property proficiency gained.) You may regain any Training Points you would have saved this way on already acquired proficiencies.

name: Weaving
description: When you take the Move action more than once in a turn, you gain +1 to your Evasion for the round.

name: Weird Resilience
description: When you finish a recovery, you may choose a damage type to become resistant to. You are resistant to this damage type until you finish another recovery and can choose a different damage type.

name: Wholeness of Body
description: As a basic action, you may regain Health equal to three times your level. You cannot be wearing armor or wielding a weapon or shield with a Strength requirement.

name: Wild Vitality
description: As a quick action, you can enter a state. While in this state, you gain resistance to all piercing, bludgeoning, and slashing damage. The state ends if you do not attack for a round or if you enter the dying condition. To use this feat you cannot be focusing on or sustaining any powers.

name: Wilt and Grow
description: As a basic action, you may choose an area within 12 spaces, roll a power attack targeting Fortitude, affecting each creature of your choice inside a 2-space radius sphere. Each creature affected takes 1d6 necrotic damage, and one creature of your choice within the area heals for 1d6. You may level this feat to increase the damage by 1d6, but the level requirement increases by 4 for each level of this feat. The fourth and seventh levels of this feat increase its uses by 1 each.

name: Wimp
description: Add Vitality multiplied by level inverted (× -1) to Terminal range. Only applicable if Vitality is negative. (Example: On a level 2, if Vitality is -2, the Terminal range gets +4.)
req_desc: Negative Vitality

name: Winning Confidence
description: Reduce all damage taken by 1 for each terminal foe on the battlefield, up to a maximum of -4 damage taken.

name: Winning Confidence II
description: Reduce all damage taken by 2 for each terminal enemy on the battlefield, up to a maximum of -8 damage taken.

name: Withdraw
description: Once per turn, when you attack with a finesse weapon, you may reduce the damage of that attack by 1d6 to move up to your movement speed after you attack.

name: Wizardly Quill
description: When acquiring Training Points from written scrolls or inscribed symbols, you may obtain double the regular amount.

name: Wrathful Summons
description: When you summon a creature using a power, you may increase its martial bonus by 1/2 of your power bonus.

name: Wreathing Rampage
description: At the beginning of your turn, enemies in the Melee Range take 1 damage for every finishing blow you had that combat (up to 5 damage per turn).

name: Zeal
description: When you achieve a critical hit, gain 1 Action Point.

name: Zealous Presence
description: As a quick action, choose up to 6 creatures within 8 spaces. These creatures get +2 to all defenses and attack rolls for one round.
